it appeared that the person had looked forward to it and reserved  
time for it.

For a few days I felt very miserable, distressed and listless,  
with crying fits. When this was over I felt very happy, although  
there was no special reason.

I was testing my new roller skates in the street, suddenly a dog  
ran barking in my direction, very threatening. I was very  
startled and terribly upset.

Recently I felt very sad without any reason. It lasted for a few  
days. There was nothing I liked in that period.

Someone told me a story of Amnesty International: a boy was  
killed and his head was put in the litter of his girlfriend. It  
looked as if she was pregnant, then she died. It is disgusting, I  
can hardly write it down.

I cried for 3 hours because I felt very miserable. Then I called  
my boyfriend and he said lovely things to me. After this feeling  
disappeared I felt ashamed.

When my boyfriend and I experience something nice or when we have  
made a nice walk together.

The weather is very bad (fog and slipperiness) the newcast  
reports many traffic accidents and my boyfriend is driving home  
and still has 60 kilometers to go.

Someone told me that he would stay at my home for one night.  
Therefore I made big efforts to make everything ok (food). One day  
before he cancelled the appointment because he had to go to  
church with his parents.

We had to take our cat to the vet for mercy killing (an  
injection).

When people are eating unsavoury (smacking, belching, speaking  
with food in their mouth, etc.).

A girl in our class was nicknamed "fatsy". Later, I heard that  
she suffered from diabetes mellitus.

I made an appointment to pick up someone. However I arrived  
too late and she had to wait a quarter of an hour.

One night I had a very good conversation with two friends. I then  
realized how worthy they were for me and how happy I was to  
have them as friends.
In the morning just before going to the dentist.

When a very close friend with whom I have a very intimate and  
bodily relationship (he had a girlfriend) started to avoid me and  
didn't want to talk to me any more.

When a good friend with whom I had an intimate relationship made  
clear that he didn't want to continue in the same way. He choose  
his girlfriend (also a friend of mine).

I had a short lasting sexual relationship with someone I didn't  
love.

When I realized that I avoided two good friends with whom I  
always shared toys and sorrows. I made up idle stories to avoid  
telling them what happened to me.

I made an appointment with a friend to drink coffee togehter.  
However, for the third time in that week she arrived an hour too  
late.

My dear hamster (called Hannes) died at the age of 2 and 1/2 years.  
His shape forced me to mercy killing (an injection).

I read a newspaper report that a little boy was forced to look  
while his sister was raped.

We had made an appointment to complete together a piece of work.  
It appeared that I was the only one who hadn't prepared anything.

I call my mother at least once a week. However last week I  
completely forgot. This morning she called me, she thought I felt  
ill.

After the funeral of an acquaintance I felt very depressed. That  
feeling turned into joy when I heard that I had achieved a good  
grade for an examination.

I had to call someone and make an appointment for a conversation.  
I was very afraid to fail.

I cannot remember exactly such a situation. But I know that  
once I went to a very dirty lavatory and that disgusted me.

I once torn the inner tube of a bike, that was not mine. Then I  
saw it was a brand new one. I felt very guilty then.

When I found out that the girl, with whom I was in love, loved me  
too.

When my mother threatened me with thrushing me of the stairs, when  
I once more should make a comment.

My mother unjustly became very angry with me and sent me to my  
room while my father explained that the way she saw things was  
not correct. I had done things with the best intentions.

My mother was very angry with my little sister and told her to  
put her hands on the table in order to beat her hands up. She  
forced by means of her power.

Once after falling in love, I imagined that particular girl to be  
perfect and completely overshadowing my girlfriend. Afterwards I  
realized that this image was not objective. I felt guilty against  
both girls.

Once a week I work as a volunteer in a biologic garden. this work  
in the garden and the contact with other volunteers filled me  
with joy. They also gave me support after I failed passing my  
driver's test.

My friend and I planned to search for old documents and utensils  
in the cellar. It was very late at night when we arrived in the  
cellar. He indicated the place where the police (40 years ago) found  
two dead bodies. I got very scared when he told me this story.

When I went up the stairs in a high, dark house full of shadows,  
passed a door and had the feeling that someone or something was  
behind me, although I knew I was alone.

A friend told me it would be better for me not to be on familiar  
terms with another friend, although, in my opinion he had no  
reason to say such things. He only said so hoping that I  
would search support from him (that, however, was not necessary).

When I see that some people remain cold and egoistic with regard  
to close friends, even in situations that those friends need  
them.

A few days ago, I hitch-hiked to Arnhems with a friend.  
Everything went well: they picked us up very quickly, the sun was  
shining, I was feeling free and, for the first time after long  
time, happy. I really had the feeling that I was living at full  
speed.

My grandmother several times has been struck by cerebral  
hemorrhages. Until now she recovered well each time, but there is  
always the threat to loose her.

I had made an appointment with three friends. We had to go out  
together. When I arrived at the place, the other persons weren't  
there. I became very angry because I thought they were gone  
without me. That, however, didn't appear to be the case.

I finished the relationship with my boyfriend, after having felt  
myself very unhappy for a long time.

I was taking a shower in a cubicle in France. Then I discovered  
that a few children were loking at me from the adjacent cubicle.

A close relative of mine underwent a difficult operation, and everything  
turned out fine.

When I get into the tube or the train without paying for the  
ticket.

A class-mate urged me to carry out a particular protest along  
with him, and when the time came this fellow drew back while I  
had to face the situation.
When I failed the entrance exam to IMEC.
When I saw someone eating live worms.

When I was a child my parents caught me with a pornographic  
magazine.

[ I can not remember anything in particular.  What I can remember  
is feelings of having done or said something which then had  
negative consequences.]
When they told me that I had got a study grant.
When I wore a grotesque figure hanging down my back.
When my father was saved from a severe work accident.

When I was a child I hid under the sheets out of fear of  
darkness.
When I first saw a person begging.
When my basket ball team lost the qualification at a final.
When I see rotten meat.
When a person whom I do not want to see is continously present.

When I got to know that I had passed the university entrance  
exam.  I thought that I had done one of the exams badly.

We hitch hiked our way back from a town rather drunk.  We were  
dropped in another town which was unknown to us.  I needed to  
urinate, so I did it on a wall which turned out to belong to the  
military headquarters.  They arrested me and made me pay a fine  
of 500 pts.  We had to go home on foot (6 km) since it was too  
late for anyone to give us a lift.

I was to meet a girl in a discotheque.  She was very pretty and I  
was very happy.  But she did not turn up.  Thank God, there were  
some other friends there and I was able to have a more or less  
good time.

I met a friend in a discotheque. he was with a girl and he told  
me that she was not his girlfriend.  I, to say something,  
commented that she must be a viscious woman.  He then told me  
that she was his girl.

I went to a pub with a group of friends (not very close) and  
I was with one girl most of the time, while the other girls in the  
group wanted to be with me.  They stopped talking to the girl I  
was with.
Before an exam which I, finally did not take.
When I had an argument with a friend.
When I am dirty because I have not had a shower for a few days.
Once I did not have enough money to pay for a coffee.
Before taking an exam.

My family told me to leave if I was not willing to accept the  
conditions they imposed on me.

A friend of mine called me when I was not at home.  I phoned her  
back to know what she wanted and she told me that she had dialled  
the wrong number.
I had to change a baby's clothes for the first time.
My younger sister was almost run over by a lorry.
When my brother was born.
Once I saw some children hunting a cat to death.
The death of a friend.
When I saw a scene on T.V where a castration was shown.
Once I answered my father rudely.

When my brother ran away from home and I thought it was because  
of my continously scolding him.

When I saw that I had passed the university entrance exam.  It  
made me forget all my problems.

When I learnt that a boy I liked had been with a girl for three  
years.

When a very dirty class-mate farted in my  presence.  There was a  
terrible smell.

When I realized that I had a hole in my trousers after having gone  
for a walk.

When I saw my 16 year old sister at home after having waited for  
her all night, not knowing where she was.

While I was waiting for them to give me the marks of the most  
difficult subject this year.

I had an argument with my mother because I criticized the rules  
she imposes at home, which are too rigid and arbitrary for me.
On seeing a scene of an accident in a magazine.

A few days back I had to ask a professor a ridiculous question  
because I had lost at a game of cards and had to pay a forfeit.
When I shouted at my mother when she was nervous and depressed.

After several days delay in my girlfriend's menstration I was  
very glad to see that the pregnancy test was negative.

When I saw a TV program on the North American military plan  
called "The startwar".
Whenever I see an alcoholic.

On New Year's Eve, when I went to the house of my girlfriend's  
parents to meet them.

When I failed an exam for which I knew that I had not studied  
hard enough.

The day the Real Madrid team of basket ball qualified for the  
final at Athens.

The last time I was face to face with with the monstrous dog  
which lives in my street.

During a trivial (friendly) discussion, one of the participants  
made an intervention which made me feel uncomfortable.

When I heard the last regulation of the socialist govrenment  
concerning pensions.
When I got to know the details if the famine in East Africa.

The last time I had to phone the Registry, after having called  
them so many times in the last few days.
When I passed an important exam.

In a rather important exam, when they caught me red handed  
copying.

When my father addressed me directly and maliciously, thus  
including me in the "family war".
When my parents got divorced.

When I was with a girl who seemed to love me, while I was with  
her just to go to bed with her.
When I passed an exam which I had failed last year.
When I go out alone at night.
A murder.
When I failed two subjects last year.
When I see people who have no sentiments.
When I triffled with other people.

When I was told that I could take a week off and go for a trip  
with my friends.
Every time I went home with my school report.

During an argument between friends, one of them accused me of  
taking advantage of some other friends who usually come to the  
university in my car, saying that I ask them too much money for  
the petrol.
A young man was insulting and humiliating a drunken man.

When I saw that I had passed an exam.  It was the last chance and  
there was a lot at stake.

On a trip to Santander we wanted to stop at a curve because a  
friend was sick, and the car skidded of the gravel.

My cousins were playing at home and one of them broke a decorative  
object which was very precious to me.

When I saw a film where a black was rapeing a girl while another one was  
filming it for a pornographic movie.

I was swimming in the sea and a wave took the top part of my  
bikini away.

I was looking after a child and she fell down because I was not  
paying her much attention.  One side of her face got bruised.

When I pass exams, or when a close friend of mine recovered  
from an illness,etc.

Fights that I see in the middle of the street, robberies, fear of  
darkness when going home.

During a family discussion on my future and my prospects as a  
student, they accused me of not bothering about looking for a job to  
assume my financial situation.
[ Depressions.]

For example, to feel bad because of one's attire, to be among  
people who do not belong to the same social class, to give a  
wrong answer in class, to be surprised in particular situations.

Some of my friends had an argument.  I had earlier phoned one  
of them and that may have influenced him to argue.

When I met a very close friend of mine after one year of  
separation.

There was an earthquake for several minutes and I was on the  
eight floor.

An argument among several friends because of the irrational  
behavior of one of them who fell out with us for no reason and  
said that we were to blame.
Pictures of Nazi extermination camps on a T.V program.

Equivocal situation when filling a security questionnaire on  
entering a government building with several people there.

I left a boy with whom I was going around without giving him any  
explanations.
When my sister was born.
When they tried to rob me.
When my grandmother died.
When I see dead dogs on the road.

When I went to see the doctor and had to take my clothes off so  
that he could examine me.

When my parents quarelled over something I had done and which was  
wrong.
When my little sister was born.

When I was attending an authorized demonstrationand the police  
rushed brutally at the demonstrators, without any warning.
When I saw a very disagreable scene.
When I had to represent my boss at a meeting.
When I passed an exam.
When they threatened me with a knife to take my money.
When my dog died.
When I saw an accident where the man lost his head.
When I tripped while getting on a bus.
When I hurt a person's feelings.
When a class-mate died.

When a person saw that I was accused of something I had not done  
and did not do anything to defend me.

I got my driving licence after they had frightened me with it's  
difficulty.

When I had to walk over three kms through a field which had wild bulls,  
because my car had broken down.

When I saw a man hitting a child of 2 years without any consideration,  
simply because the child had been leaning against a window.
When I had to dissect a live mouse at school.

When I saw a program on Ethiopia on T.V, a fews hours earlier I  
had thrown away some clothes and food.

When I saw that the mark I had obtained in an exam was a good  
one.

We were in the country and I walked away from the others one  
night.  Suddenly something moved sharply in front of me and I was  
not able to see what it was.

When I was young, I became very angry as I was not allowed to  
stay up all night for the fair in my town.

When summer is over and I have to leave the town where I spend my  
holidays.

When I inadvertantly entered the ladies room and met some girls  
on my way out.

I was entrusted with an object and while using it I handled it  
carelessly and it broke.

When I learned, after the ecography, that my mother was expecting a  
baby girl.  That was what I wanted.

One night, walking along a park, I began to think that some  
roughnecks would appear suddenly with knives and things like  
that.

I had an exam and I had it well prepared.  I did the first part  
very well but did not know the second part.
When my parents did not let me go on a study tour.

One day I was going through the street door of my house, when a  
man asked me for a doctor.  He then showed me his genitals and  
asked me to cure him myself.

I had an argument with my boyfriend.  It was my fault but my  
pride would not let me admit it.

An invitation to spend 5 days at the seaside with all expenses  
paid.
A film on zombies.

When males in my family try to assign house duties exclusively  
with referance to sex.

I had a quarrell with my boyfriend and decided to finish with him  
and and my Easter holidays.

When after a storm in the country, I left my shelter and saw a  
big, fat, slimy green toad by my side.

When my brother had to spend all evening repairing a gear-lever  
that I had broken.

When I was walking down the street, some boys showed me a knife  
and stole all my money.

When they threw my holder down on the floor, with all my notes for  
an exam inside it and they got all mixed up.
When my mother was operated.

One day I got on the bus without any money or season ticket and  
the driver threw me out.
When a friend of mine was beaten for what was my fault.

My father had an operation which lasted for hours.  We were all  
very worried but it was successful.

I was walking along a subway when I saw a group of louts.  I was  
rather afraid because I was alone.

An old woman was violently thrown down the stairs of the tube by  
a group of louts.

A child, 9 years old, died in a stupid way.  He fell from a place  
which was 1 metre high.

On the road there was a dead animal with its entrails showing and  
its skull crushed.

We were discussing a subject ( I knew very little about it) and I  
was holding my ground.  They showed me that I was wrong.

I could have passed the last exam of the public competition, but  
I failed as I had not studied.

I was studying in the library and a class-mate told me that she  
had obtained a grant to work in the library.

Before knowing my marks I was not sure that I wanted to go to  
that class.

I was in the cafeteria at the university and a class-mate told me  
that a friend of hers had had all her teeth taken out because of  
an infection caused by her eating a rat's nail in her hamburger.

I had to meet a girlfriend to go out for a drink and she arrived  
with her aunt, to whom I was introduced.  Then the aunt left.

One night, after having decided to finish our relationship, I  
took my girlfriend home.  While driving back home, I felt that I  
had not handled the whole thing very well.
A typical family argument.
When I pass an exam.
Continous fear of a nuclear war.
When someone in my family died.
To loose friends because of them over-estimating themselves.
When people next to me play the fool.
To force someone to do something that suits me.

I thought that I was going to fail a subject and so I began to  
study for the final exam, then my friend told me that I had  
passed it.  That meant that I could go home, as I do not study in  
my hometown.

I was in Sierra Nevada, climbing a peak over 3,000 metres high,  
without any light and with many other problems.  I was afraid for  
my life.
The man who threw me out of the flat disgusted me.

The first time that I caressed a girl, I was about thirteen and  
she was eighteen.  I noticed that it did not affect her at all.

I was going around with a girl without loving her.  Not only did  
I go around with her, but we did many more things.  In the end I  
was not very sincere to her.

I met a girlfriend again after not seeing her for several months.  
 I saw her in a discotheque.  We do not like discotheques but we  
went there because we knew we would meet there.

I was walking in the countryside alone when I came across two  
dogs who began barking at me.  I did not know whether they were  
tied up or loose, but I was afraid of them approaching me.

My mother was working with a knife and we were all laughing  
heartily.  She was not able to control the knife and stuck it  
deep into her hand.

I read a book whose plot and expressions were obscene and in very  
bad taste.

It was about midnight and I wanted to go to the countryside (I  
was in town) to watch the stars in the sky.  My mother did not  
like this, in spite of it I went out for a while.  My mother got  
angry.

A friend of mine suggested that I become a film extra.  The idea  
seemed very funny to me and my reaction seemed rather outlandish  
to the others.

One day I went to the cinema to see a film in which I was  
interested.  On arriving there I saw a long queue (which I had  
not expected) and went back home without seeing the film.

When I miss the train and I am late, and I have to wait half an  
hour for the next one.

I saw in an ice-cream kiosque a cockroach walking through a  
cornet.

One day in class, the professor asked me a question concerning something  
he had been explaining.  He was very close to me (beside me) and I  
had no idea what to answer.

When they phoned me from Great-Britain to tell me that I could go  
there, if I wished, in Summer.
When I was operated on the knee and had to go through rehabilitation.

In a very important basket-ball match where a lot was at stake, I  
played very badly.

When a friend of mine told me that he was going to commit  
suicide.

When I passed my driving test, as it was the fifth time that I  
had taken this test.

I was given an exam which I thought did not measure at all my  
ability or my knowledge of the subject.

When I saw the film "Johnny got his gun" which deals with the  
consequences of the Vietnam war.

Some friends and I were having lunch.  Someone said something  
funny and one of the guys started laughing and spat his food in a girl's  
face.

I was alone in the bus when I tripped and fell, and dropped all  
my papers.
When I passed the university entrance exam.

One night, while I was sleeping, I woke up suddenly with the  
sensation that there was someone in my room.
When my brother was held up and robbed.
When they told me that my grandfather was rather ill.
When I see someone vomitting.
When I fell head on in a fountain.

I had to undergo an operation in Summer and so my family had to  
stay at home during the holidays.  I felt guilty, above all  
because of my brothers.

I had decided to propose to the man I liked to make a trip  
together.  One day, during breakfast I told him my idea.  I was  
afraid of his not accepting it and that the idea would end up as  
a failure.

I was having breakfast with a classmate and suddenly I began to  
cry as I thought of a friend of mine whom I had not seen for a  
long time.

During lunch with some classmates, a priest was also there.  He  
was eating desperately as if someone was going to take his plate  
away.  He did it with gluttony.  He wiped his hands on his suit  
several times and it was full of crumbs.

When a professor caught me absent-minded and not paying attention  
to what he was saying.

At a party, on New Year's Eve, I met on old friend whom I had not  
seen for some time

Once I failed seven subjects at school and I was terrified to  
give my report card to my father.  I left it on the table and went to  
bed very early in order to avoid him seeing me.

I have a very close friend who lives in another city and we have  
been writing to each other for a long time.  The last time I went  
to her city, just to see her, I was disappointed to see how great  
the distance between us was.

They asked me to throw the rubbish into a dustbin which had some  
awful liquid accumulated at the bottom.

I was driving a friend's car, and I got close to the pavement to  
ask my way and I struck a parked car.

Every time, in the last few days, when my girlfriend told me that  
she loves me.

I stayed alone in the dark at night in the mountain, waiting for  
my uncle.  I remember that I took a big stone and it calmed me.

We were at school, in the room for audiovisual classes.  We were  
watching a film, and just behind me two classmates were bothering  
me with their mocking and shoves.  I reacted angrily (I suppose)   
by hitting one of them.

[ During a summer holiday a French girl and I had becoe back  
home, I felt very sad.]
When my mother had a nervous illness.
One day I went to see a rather disagreeable film (X).
Once I had to visit a rather special person.
When I knew the feelings of a beloved person.
A fall during a climb, with almost with no previous experience.

On the occasion of assignment of tasks and responsibilities in  
which such an assignment, dispropotionately carried with it high  
responsibility and low ability of organisation and resolution.
When I had to sleep in a bed at a hostel, which was full of dirt.

While shopping, a person close to us created an uncomfortable  
situation for those who were with her.

Incomprehension and repression towards a child's behaviour,  
commonly not accepted, and making the child cry.

In a dark street at 4 o'clock in the night and there was  
complete silence.

When the train taking me to my military service left the station,  
on the platform remained relatives, projects and goodtimes.  I  
had a hard year ahead.

A situation of overt unfairness, manipulation of people and its  
consequences.

I was talking to a friend and he said something which was very  
funny.

When I was young I saw a horror film.  Then when I went to sleep,  
the film came back too my mind and the characters frighteneed my  
imagination.

In a confrontation with a person, he provoked me several times  
till I reacted in an angry way.  Fortunately there were no  
disastrous consequences.
I was watching a sad film and it affected me deeply.

When I was reading a book.  It had nothing to do with the book  
itself but with the disagreable smell of the pages of the book.

In an exam I answered the questions rather carelessly and  
afterwards I thought that the exam would have been better had I  
answered more carefully.

When I had an argument with my best friend and I thought that I  
was right and she was not.

When I realized that it was impossible for me to be as free as I  
had imagined and that I could not do anythong about it.

When I do or say something inappropriate which hurts people close  
to me.

We went to visit my mother at the residence.  She was crying and  
said that she was about to die.  I believed all her complaints  
and continously thought of the possibility of loosing her.

My dog had been run over and died near the house.  We had to pick  
him up, cold and glassy eyed, to get rid of the corpse.

A professor was going to read aloud in class a composition of  
mine in which I had criticized some political attitudes and also  
some class-mates.   I was ashamed at having written that.

In an exam when I answered the questions with very little  
assurance due to insufficiet preparation.

My father began to say incoherant things concerning my brother's and  
my own behaviour towards him.  His biased (authoritarian) and  
ridiculous point of view made us angry.
I had failed some subjects in mathematics.

This morning I spent a lot of time on my toilet and missed the  
train to the university.  My mother told me that I spent more  
time than a woman on my toilet.  I felt a mixed emotion of shame  
and anger.

I was alone at home when I broke a figure and then mended it.  A  
few days later my mother noticed it and asked me about it, I told  
her that I had no idea.

When I fell crazily in love with a beautiful girl and she returned  
my love.

When I was the target of a great many insults and completely  
unfair accusations of a large group of people.
When my best friend died, at the age of 16.

When I entered a brothel and saw two sailors with a young  
prostitute who was not older than 18.

When I was in a religious school my teacher showed me up in front  
of all my class-mates.  They were very sarcastic and cruel.

When I came across an old friend whom I had not seen for a very  
long time.
When I was accused of something I had not done.
A close friend died.
I saw some images of a decapitation in a horror film.
I made another person cry for an unjustified cause.

I received an unexpected letter from a friend I had met a short  
time before.  He sent me a poem and wished me good luck.  I felt  
very happy because I had great esteem for that person.

I was walking with another person when a "gang" separted us and  
pushed me in to a house, hit me in the stomach and the face, then  
they left - leaving me bleeding.

A certain person started to say dreadful things very calmly, I  
felt hurt and disgusted.

A certain person whom I respect and esteem a lot pays me no  
attention.  She keeps up appearances but shows almost no interest  
in me.

In a bus I fell sick and vomitted in a bag.  The entire situation  
was disgusting in itself.

A person (a male) told me that he liked me.  He has a problem, he  
is a homosexual.

When I received some good news : I obtained an amount of money I  
needed to buy something I had been planning to buy.

My parents were having a typical family argument.  I came in and  
saw the scene and became angry.

I visited a place in Morocco where they worked the leather.  I  
saw the skins emerged in a liquid which ressembled putrification.

I was in a cafe with another person when, suddenly, several close  
friends of my partner appeared.  I did not know what to do and my  
partner felt uncomfortable.
When I talk to my friends.
When people harrass me I feel oppressed by their behavior.
When I am with a friend and we have to leave each other.

[ When I act thinking that I know everything and I then realize  
that there were things I had not thought about, thus hurting  
others.]

[ Any situation in everyday life has this emotional sense, in  
class, in the street, at home, at the table..........]

On a dark night I felt that there were several people near me  
and I did not know who they were.

When I learned that several people had died in the street due to   
the cold weather.

When I saw in the newspapers, on the T.V, and magazines the  
chaotic situation caused by the drought and hunger in  
Mauritania.
The physical appearance of a meal.

In a situation with my girlfriend I took a decision.  Later when  
I thought about it, I realized that it was an erroneous decision.

During a demonstration I climbed up the closed central door of a  
bus.  When the bus stopped I had to go back to the same place,  
afraid that the police would see me.

When I saw parents punishing their little child for something he  
had not done.  In my opinion, even if he had done it he should  
not have been punished for it.

A friend of mine was hurt as he thought that our relationship was  
not the same as before and something had gone wrong.

When I was young, one day in the car we fell sick and ended up  
vomitting on each other.

When they told me that I had been admitted to the faculty of  
medicine.
Almost always when I go to fetch the results of an exam.
[ No description.]

I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an         
operation.

I was watching T.V with my parents and some pornographic scenes  
came on, I felt uncomfortable and tried to distract my parents  
attention by talking to them.

When I used an adjective for a person without knowing what it  
meant.   When I got to know the meaning, I felt guilty as it was  
a clear and unfair insult.
When I obtained good marks in a subject I had failed before.
When a friend of mine told me a horror story.

I was with my family and we found some abandoned puppies.  I  
wanted to help them but everyone said no.  We then left.
At my grandfather's death.
Seeing a film in which there were several bloody crimes.

At a concert an old man arrived and began to danse, sing and do  
silly things.

I had an argument with a friend of mine.  She would not let me  
speak and then I began to shout at her.  She got angry and left,  
I did not try to prevent her from leaving.

When I was told that they had got tickets for me for a film  
marathon I wanted to see.

We were on the road in a car when a lorry bypassed us.  We had to  
swerve and we almost got run over.

I was in a very small class and the professor said something  
about me that made everyone look at me at the same time.

I had arranged to meet my friends at a certain place, and I was  
with other people.  My friends did not arrive and the people who  
were with me began to get tired.  My friends were one hour late.

I thought that I would be scolded for a comment I had made, which  
I should not have made.

My sister came back home and reproached me for not having tidied  
up the house, although I had been working all morning and she had  
done nothing.

At my grandfather's funeral.  I remembered that the thing he  
liked and respected most was earth, I thought that he had  
attained what he wanted and was not separated from it any longer.

I had to wash my grandmother because she did not get to the  
bathroom on time.

In a very crowded shop I was distracted and missed my turn in the  
queue.  A woman who was behind me began to shout at me asking me  
either to pay more attention or to leave.

I was in my village when a bull jumped over a fence and started  
chasing my friends and me.  We were very frightened till we  
climbed up a tree.

I failed a subject despite the fact that I had studied quite a  
lot for it.

I liked a boy and I would feel shy and then blush.  The more I  
wanted to avoid it the more I blushed.

I am not very affectionate and I feel guilty as I do not give as  
much affection as I receive.

I was spending the week-end with some friends.  We were waiting  
for another friend and we went to the meet him at the bus stop, a   
woman we met there told us that the coach had already left.  I  
was afraid that I would not see my friend, but at last we found  
him.

I was walking down a little village at night.  There was nobody  
in the steet.  A dog began to bark, I felt that it was following  
me.  Then I began to run, the other dogs started barking too.  At  
last I arrived home.
I was told that a friend of mine was going to Mexico for good.
Finding a hair in the soup.

I was at the University dining room, alone, and at a table next  
to mine thre were several professors.  One of them asked me to  
join them.  I refused but she insisted.  All the others started  
looking at me and I had to move to their table.

I was on holidays, and I was going to meet a friend whom I had  
not seen for six months.  Again I felt very happy.

I sent a book to a friend of mine.  The book meant a lot to me  
and he lost it.
Ever since I have been a child, the sight of any kind of wound.
At the seaside, when a wave suddenly came and took off my bikini.

One night, I went out with some friends for dinner and I did not  
tell my parents that I would come back late.  I thought of  
phoning but in the end I did not.  When I arrived home, my  
parents were very worried.

My sister in law was about to have a child, and there were some  
problems.  They had to do a Caesarean.  After a while, everything   
was all right.
Waiting for my marks in a difficult subject.

I gave some personal information to a friend of mine, and he told  
it to some others who were implicated in the affair.

At a meeting with over one hundred people, they decided who had to speak  
from the stand by drawing lots.

I had a small argument with a relative and some other people got  
implicated.  It resulted in a proper row.

Last course, when I passed with good marks three subjects which I had  
previously failed.

I was drinking coffee in a cafe and I found a piece of scrubber  
in my cup.

At school, I did not tell the teacher that it was me who  
had laughed, and she punished the entire class by making them  
stay behind for one hour.

One evening, I was with a group of friends having a talk.  There  
was a very trustful and joyful atmosphere.

We were walking in the park at night.  It was very dark and very  
late.  We began to hear foot steps all around us, and we could  
not find our way out.

[ One day I arrived home rather tired and found the house..... In  
addition I was asked many questions which I did not want to  
answer.]

I was selected to do a rest for a foreign ballet but I did not  
have the money to do it.

In a film there was a scene in which a rat was sliding on a bed,  
leaving a trace of blood behind, finally it entered the mouth of  
one of the actors.

I was swimming in the river and I lost the top of my bikini.  I  
did not notice it and came out of water.  There was a  
disagreeable classmate watching the scene.

At a party, several comments were made about the personal  
situation of one of the people present.  She was rather affected  
and uncomfortable.

It was Saturday, my duties were over for a few hours and I could  
at last be with the people I wanted to see.

One night, I was alone at home.  My fear was caused by some  
strange noises which put my imagination to work.

When I got to know about the reaction of a friend of mine in a  
certain situation.  I had not expected him to react that way.
I saw a sort of black worm being attacked by many ants.
When I met a friend of mine after several months.

I was going to my village, after having been rather oppressed in  
Madrid.

My mother read a letter that a friend of mine had written to me  
telling me how she had got drunk the last time.

I found a cockroach crushed between two folders in my bedroom, I  
called my mother.

I ride my motorbike in my village and everyone stares at me as if  
I was a rare specimen.

I was spending a few days at my aunt's place.  One night I got  
home very late, I had told them I was going to a party but I went  
to another place.  They were very worried.

Last Summer I achieved someting that I had been wanting for a  
long time.

My parents scolded me a lot for something I had not done.  It was  
my sister who had done it.

Due to a misunderstanding on my part, two of my best friends  
quarelled.

When my brother was born, everything went all right.  It had been  
very likely that he would have a deficiency (my sister suffers  
from Down's Syndrome) and that my mother would be in danger.

When an English teacher unfairly made me repeat a semester which  
I thought I had passed.  I had to ask my parents for some more  
money to carry on studying.

In a park near our home, a group of young people who were  
strangely dressed were seated in the middle of the street.  They  
began to eat while carressing each other.

I feel this emotion very often when I try to express my feelings  
in public, because other people do not understand my reactions  
and think that I am silly.

A friend of mine said in a group that she felt lonely and  
withdrawn from everyone because of mental deficiency.

When I passed the university entrance exam.  I had thus finished  
with a difficult period of my life and I was about to begin one  
which I had desired a lot.

When I was at home alone, I felt a super-natural force, dangerous  
for me and the people close to me.

When I came to know that my father and his parents were : self  
interested, dirty, negative, egoist, bad peolpe,......

I think that the only time I really felt shame was when I was  
very young and I had to defecate on the street.  I was very  
worried in case someone should see me.
On my birthday, when I was given my presents.

We were riding in a friend's car.  He was driving very fast and  
suddenly a another car crossed the road in front of us.  My  
friend had to turn the car rapidly.

When I went to see the result of an exam and saw that I had  
failed.

The mother of a friend of mine passed by me and saw me sitting  
on a boy's lap.  I tried to greet her but could not help  
blushing.

A friend of mine had the sleeves of a leather coat stolen from  
his car.  It was me who had left them there for everyone to see.

The final marks were to be given in the morning.  I wanted to get  
there late because I was very afraid.  When I arrived there,  
everybody was very happy and I had also passed.  We had a  
wonderful time all day long.

I went to visit a friend in hospital.  He was going to be  
operated the next day.  I was afraid that they would not let me  
in and I did not know what his reaction would be on seeing me.

A friend of mine played a joke on another friend over the  
telephone.  This friend, crying, called me and I got very angry  
and made the other person apologize.

A friend of mine told me that my boyfriend had been with another  
girl this Summer.  We had been going out together for four years  
and we had not done so for the last three months.  I could not  
believe it.

I was at a friend's place for lunch and she fell ill and  
vomited.

I was dancing in a theatre.  I was not sure whether some frieends  
of mine had come to see me.  I was very scared of doing things  
wrong.

Classes were over and I wanted to go home.  A friend of mine  
asked me to wait for half an hour to take him back home.  I said  
no.
On holiday, seeing the lanscape in Gerona.
Travelling by coach on a rather narrow and wet road.

They wanted me to pay for a ticket twice because they said that  
the one I had was out of date.
When I saw an insect going up my arm.
When I entered a bar looking for a friend.

Arguing with my younger cousin.  She is rather a nuisance but I  
felt sorry.

Once, when I was very young, my mother left me alone in the  
house and came back very late.

When my aunt told me angrily that I was a good-for-nothing and  
she was fed up with my behaviour.
When a person I did not know hurt a friend of mine.

When the literature teacher made me recite a poem in the middle  
of the class and I had to gesticulate.

Once, when I arrived home very late, my parents had an argument  
because of this; my mother wanted to stand up for me.

I was spending my summer holidays in a village.  My friend and I  
were coming back from a discotheque at night and we heard a noise  
from an alley.  We were very scared and we got into my friend's house.  
 A moment later, an unknown car picked up a person from this  
alley.

My mother and I had an argument over buying some clothes for me.   
She did not accept the fact that I did not like the same things  
as her, and we ended up shouting at each other.

One day, I was home and there was a phone call informing me that  
some of my relatives had died in an accident.

When I saw a film in which there was a scene where women were cut  
to pieces.  Above all, it was the blood and the confusion which  
impressed me most.

I was walking to school and I passed by a red cross post where  
there were many soldiers.  They began to pass remarks at me.

A friend of mine trusted me to back her in a decision she had  
made.  But when the moment came I did not agree with her opinion.
When my grandfather died.

When I was young I was told to to the shop to buy a dozen eggs.   
I went and asked for one egg and the people in the shop laughed  
at me and so did my family when I told them what had happened.

When I arrived home late at night.  I know that my mother gets  
worried and this made me feel angry.

When I was told that my daughter, who is at a boarding school,  
was very ill and that they needed me there the same day.

One day in a clinic, the father of a child came in and assaulted  
a colleague for something that she had not done deliberately.
When I was told that my uncle had passed away.

The transport to pick us up for lunch was always late and the  
driver made the same excuse every day.
When I did not give back a text book to a friend in time.

When a cousin of mine was discharged from the hospital after        
a long illness.  I had thought that this illness would never end.

When a man who had a knife grabbed me and threatened me with it,    
during my holidays in Monze.

A certain friend tried to push me off a seat in a very violent  
way for no apparent reason.  It may be that he was excited about  
something.

When the neighbour of a friend of mine was stabbed to death by  
thieves in Kabwe.  They stole his van.

When we were young, a friend of mine tried to dissect a frog while   
we were playing near his home.

The time I shouted at most of my friends at a party.  It was as if  
 all my friends had done something wrong, or may be it was the  
influence of the beer.

When I blamed my niece for misplacing my book, she denied having  
touched or seen it but I carried on insisting that it was her.

When I was about six years old, I mistook a cat for a leopard       
when it entered my room at night.

When a person the same age as me insisted that I call him  
"Mister".  I refused to succumb, but he persisted and I got angry  
as he had belittled me.

When I lost my father on the 25th of September,1970.  He died of  
a sore on the leg.

When I failed the grade 7 twice and only passed it the third  
time.

I was going around with a foreigner's wife and my entire family  
got to know about it, this was just when I had become a  
Christian.
When I first passed a job interview.

I was almost caught in the girls hostel by the security men, I  
would have been expelled from school had I been caught.

When I was accused of having refused to do some hostel work while  
I was at school.  Actually I had not been allocated any work.

A friend of mine could not make it back to Unza after having  
failed the exams.

I usually come back home early but this day I came home back late  
to find some visitors at my place.

I got pass marks in the H.S.S compulsory courses while most  
people performed well.

I destroyed my step-brother's bedsheets by mistake, they were the  
only ones he had.
When I heard that I had made it to the second year at UNZA.

When my father's home was to be broken into by thieves who had  
guns.

When a friend tried to back bite me on false grounds.  This made  
me wonder if he was a really a good friend.
When my girlfriend's nephew passed away.
When someone whom I trusted, disappointed me terribly.

When I hooked a girl in Kitwe.  She was very beautiful for my  
standards, a rare bird of this kind accepted me as a boyfriend.

1976, Soweto uprising in South Africa and the racist Gout's  
reaction to the students demands concerning the educational  
system.

When I was found urinating, behind a toilet instead of inside it,  
by my class mates and the teachers.  I was told to pick up my own  
urine from the wet soil, I did it.

When my uncle found me having sexual intercourse with a distant  
relative of mine in the sitting room, on the couch.  I failed to  
stop and get up, I carried on.

When I was accepted for further education, here at the  
university.

When I was accused by my brother of having stolen a 5 kwatcha  
note from my mother's bag.  I was beaten up for this, the money  
was found later.

When I was refused a transfer from my school to another, simply  
because it was far away from my house.

When I was taking an exam in grade 5.  The examinator found me  
with a note-book and accused me of copying, All the students  
laughed at me.
When I was caught stealing mangoes in a certain compound.
When I received a letter telling me that my mother was very ill.

When a drunkard, in town yelled at me saying that I was a  
prostitute.

When I went to my room-mate's drawer to see if she had an iron   
which I could use, she came in.  I felt guilty as she may have  
thought that I had been stealing.
When I had my four children.
When two of my children were critically ill with measles.
When I got a low grade in an administration course.
When I got divorced from my husband after ten years of marriage.

When I woke up at night to find a fire spreading towards the bed  
-rooms.  I was very frightened as I realized that I faced death.

I experienced this emotion when my friend committed suicide after  
we had spent the afternoon playing and discussing life and it's  
problems.

When I heard of the assassination of the Indian prime-minister,  
Indira Gandhi.

When I got drunk at a party and made a fool of myself by  
vomitting all over the place and insulting the people who were  
there with me.

When I was caught sneaking back into the house at night after  
having  gone to a disco without permission.
When a thief broke into my house at night.
When my sister broke my china tea set.
I felt very sad when my son died after a short illness.
I met my best friend's husband with a prostitute.
When I failed to answer a simple question.

My brother wanted money but I refused to give it to him, two days  
later he stole it from my father.
When I was nearly beaten up by the brother of my girlfriend.

When I heard that my girlfriend was talking behind my back and  
looking down on me.

When a friend, who has been with me at school, failed to make it  
to UNZA.

When I was told by the doctor, after many months of coughing,  
that I had tuberculosis.

When a cousin of mine took my bottle of T.B tablets, put water in  
it and threw it in the dust-bin.

When five of my friends at the secondary school found out the bad  
things that I had been saying about them.

When my mother returned from a holiday, I told her a lie i.e my  
father had brought another woman home while she was away.

One evening I saw the old guard-man I knew, change into something  
inhuman for about 5-10 seconds, this really frightened me.

When I was mistakenly accused of being a thief when I accidently  
gave a fake coin at a counter.  I realized this before I handed  
over the coin, but the man called me a thief and called a  
witness.

The day I woke up to find that a kitten I had wanted to keep had  
been eaten by the neighbour's dogs.  It had been locked out by my  
wife who claimed that it had dirtied the sheets.

My mother caught me stealing some food when I was a young  
boy.

I felt joy when I came to know Christ.  That is when I became a  
Christian.
When I broke the window pane of my next door neighbour's house.
When my father thought that I was an unrelaible son.

When my uncle gave me my first year's results.  I opened the  
envelope and my eyes ran into two "B+" - in EC110 and M160, this  
meant that I had qualified for a major in economics.

I turned the knob of my granny's two band radio and did not hear  
any broadcast,  " What ! Have I broken the knob ? How much does  
it cost ? What if the spare part is not available ? "  --I did  
not know how to tune a radio.

I peeped into Maurine's bedroom and saw two people - Maurine anbd  
my step-dad.  I thought, " Why did she break her promises ? Why  
had she invited me ? Why do old men go for young girls ? "

I stormed into the room, hoping to cool myself with some soft  
music from my three band radio cassette.  There was only young  
Kaley there and he explained, " Your aunt has sold it as she  
wanted to buy clothes."

My cousin knocked on the door, looking for me to get her watch  
back.  I had given it to my girlfriend, Lizzy, as a present.

This was when the girl I was in love with accepted my proposal  
and everything went smoothly, just as I had wanted it to.  It was  
contrary to my previous feelings of uncertainty about her  
response.

It was when I dreamt that I had encountered Satan, he wanted to grab me  
and take me to his kingdom.  He was very repulsive and I have  
never seen anything like that before.

This was when I found out that a cousin of mine had taken away my  
trousers without my consent.

When I failed a test at my primary school.  I was then in grade 7  
and we were about to take the main exam.

This was when I saw, for the first time, a naked woman  
(prostitute) run away from a house after having been discovered  
by the guardian.

When I was afraid to tell my sports teacher at secondary school  
that I had not participated in the sports activities the previous  
day.

I was in grade 7.  We had an inter-house volley-ball competition.  
 In Luapula I was the youngest member of the team and I scored   
the winning goal using my head.  I jumped up with joy and fell  
down.

I was escorting a relative on a bike, we passed by a dark road  
with bushas on each side.  Half way down this road, suddenly, we    
saw a white dog appear from one side.  Before we could do  
anything, it had vanished and moreover it did not seem to have  
any legs.

The comrade staying next doors insulted me for what he called   
the misuse of his iron.  He called me stupid, self centered etc.   
I wanted to punch him but instead went for a walk to the mining  
school to cool off.

A close relative was at odds with a very powerful firm.  All his  
things had been taken, His dad had died a little before this  
event.  He gathhered his children and vowed to give them a good  
life with a new start - the words were hollow, he bit back his  
tears .....I asked to be excused and then went and cried in the  
loo.
A pig in the well from which we drink.

My girlfriend had started going around with another boy.  Her  
cousin, also a friend of mine, asked her as to who she preferred.  
 Both of us were present and she chose the other guy.

I bumped my dad's car in a lamp post.  He was not at home then,  
neither was he home when I left for the campus.  I did not tell  
him about the accident and I will never tell him.

I was at school whhen I received a letter from the dean of my  
school congratulating me for my performance at the previous  
year's exam.

This was at secondary school, a prefect framed up some case and  
took it to the deputy head-master.  I was called by the  
head-master and he threatened to suspend me.

When I travelled all the way to my former school to collect my  
certificate, only to be told that I owed them some money, I knew  
nothing about this.

I felt guilty when I heard the results of my friend, who had  
failed.  I wished that I had helped him.
My being admitted to UNZA.
While paddling in the river during a storm.  I feared drowning.

I entrusted a friend with the delivery of some money to my  
father, however he misused the money.
The loss of my mother.

When I had sufficient amount of money, I brought more clothes for  
myself than for the children - I  felt bad about it.
My trouser's zipper was open when I was at a public wedding.
When a friend left me and went back home for good.
When I failed an exam.
Insulted my girlfriend during a peptalk.
I caught a close relative with the servant of the house.

When I discovered that the people I trusted most were talking  
behind my back.
When I heard about the death of my aunt.

When my brother promised me money but he failed to fulfill the  
promise.

I was running in front of a crowd when I slipped and fell on a  
wet lawn.
When I took drugs.

As the time to get the results drew near I became more and more  
anxious.  My friend called me and said, " You have passed."  My  
heart was full of joy.

I watched a very terrfying film in LT2.  This film really pushed  
my heart out of my body and I was forced to go out before the  
second reel ended.

One Saturday morning I had got ready to go out swimming with my  
friends.  Unfortunately the weather did not permit it, so we  
stayed indoors.

I remember deceiving my brother, I told him that I was going to  
attend the Sunday service, instead I went out to the town with a friend.

When I heard that a close relative of mine had given birth at a  
very young age, in a very remote area and had had very few problems.
The possibility of having failed the examination.

When I realized that I did not have the basic things needed by a  
student like me.

When some people, including me, are treated in a way which  
equates them to an animal or a thing.
When someone I know was caught in an "adultery" situation.

My girlfriend wrote to me telling me that she was four months  
pregnant and that I was responsible for the "damages".  This made  
me happy as I longed to have a child to call mine.

The shooting started and we all lay down to protect ourselves  
from the flying bullets.  This incident occured on our way to  
Feira, during the Zambia army patrols in the Rhodesia war.

That afternoon I received two messages informing me, one that my  
brother was in a coma in the U.T.H suffering (kidney disease) and  
two, that my uncle met with an accident on his way to the hospital  
 to see my brother.

This happened when I went to visit my friend in Chelston and  
found him screwing my girlfriend.

When I walked out of my room with only my pants on and found my  
girlfriend and her female friend looking for me outside.

My father caught me having sexual intercourse with my closest  
cousin.  There was nothing wrong with it but the female was too  
old for me.
When my uncle died.

A class-mate answered (accidentally) the call of nature in the  
class during a tough mathematics examination.

I was double crossing my fiancee and one day she caught me red  
handed.  She forgave me later.  I was very ashamed of what I had  
done.

I took some money from my parent's house without asking them for  
it, and I was caught red handed.

I was approaching my exam time and my books got stolen.  I was in  
a panic as I thought that I would not do well enough to be  
considered for the economics quota.  I cried a lot but that did  
not help and as the exam day came near a strange fear gripped me.

I was annoyed this particular day as it seemad that the odds were  
not in my favour.  My grandfather added fuel to the fire, when I   
had an important appointment so I unleashed my anger on him.

It was the time I went home for my holidays only to find that my  
sister had passed away.  The news had been hidden from me, so  
that I could take my exams.

Dad had just married his second wife (my step-mother) and I did  
not like her so I went to the wardrobe and set fire to her  
dresses.  Eveyone suspected my brother and he had to bear the  
consequences.  Nobody ever got to know that it was me who had  
done it.
When I was accepted at UNZA.
When I heard a lion roar for the first time.

When a friend told me that my education had nothing to do with  
our discussion.  This friend has failed the 7th grade, what made  
me angry was that I had not used my education to argue.
When my beloved grandfather died.

I was disgusted at the university wanting some of us to travel  
from our homes to the lectures here every day.  The way the whole  
thing was handled disgusted me.

When I cheated my father about the book allowance at university.   
He discovered that we were given K150 per year for books.

I experienced joy when I got the results - I had made it to the  
second year.

This happened recently, I  was in the dining hall and one of my  
friends with whom I was eating called me a fool.

I experienced this when my maternal grandmother passed away.  She  
was the last of my grand parents to pass away.

This happened when I could not get into the school I had  
initially wanted, and ended up doing something I had never  
thought I would do.

I insulted the girl to whom I had proposed when she turned me  
down.

My mother had sent me to buy a few things.  The change I brought  
back was not right as I had given away some money to a friend  
thinking that she would not notice it.  However, my mother told  
me that the change was not correct.
When my first child was born.

I was walking through a thick forest and there was a big snake at  
a distance of about four metres.

When my daughter began staying away from classes - at the age of  
nine only.

When my wife died in hospital, she was pregnant and had undergone  
an operation.
I received a letter of acceptance from UNZA.

We were driving at night and I realized that a car was following  
us.
I reachad home to find that my baby had not been bathed and fed.
I saw a friend's husband with another woman.
I scolded my sister without waiting for her explanation.

I accused my husband of being late deliberately when he came to  
pick me up from work.

When I was appointed by the Ministry of health to join the  
teaching staff of one of the medical colleges.

When I took blood from a patient for alcohol estimation and  
urine for some other examination, he told me that something bad  
would happen to me as he would play magic on me.

When my close friend was involved in an accident and passed away  
instantly.  He had gone to buy a new car and had asked me to  
wait at his home so that I could see his new car.

When I was told that the brother who was staying with me would  
not go to the training school that year but only the year after.

When I broke up my relationship with my former girlfriend as she  
would ask me irrelevant quetions about my past.

I was sleeping when I heard the neighbours screaming, I peeped  
through the window and saw a thief  trying to enter my  
neighbour's house.

I was annoyed when a person higher up asked me why a particular  
job was not done, it was not my job to do it.

My brother came to tell me about some problems we had in the   
family.  I felt sad because I thought that if my mother had not  
gone away when this brother was younger, things would have been  
different.

I was in a train when a woman started talking loudly and  
attracting everybody's attention.  The worst thing was that she  
was discussing something, about which she knew nothing, with another person.

After a jogging session I had severe abdominal cramps and this  
lead to my wanting to empty my bladder.  My friends gathered  
around me and two of them had to help me to the toilet.  I was  
ashamed at having to go to the toilet in the presence of my  
friends.

A certain woman had asked me to make something for her and I kept  
putting it off.  When I finally made it, I did not see her for  
days only to be told one day that she had collapsed and died.  I  
felt quite guilty as she had jokingly said that I might not do  
what she had requested me to do.

I had gone for a medical check-up at the U.T.H and failed to make  
it back on time for the C119 practical sessions at 1400 hours  
last academic year.
When my aunt passed away in early 1982.

When I failed to secure employment after my form 5 in Lusaka despite  
my excellent certificate.

When I beat up a first year student at my secondary school in  
my capacity as the deputy head boy.  He had woken up late in the   
morning for manual work.

When I heard that someone who is very close to me did very well  
in the exams despite having fooled around a lot.

When a friend and me played a joke on our boyfriends.  Her  
boyfriend came up and accused me of having planned the whole  
thing and said that I did not deserve my boyfriend.  He  
embarassed me in front of a crowd.

When my family and I heard of the death of my grandfather.  We had  
 seen him a few weeks earlier and it seemed that he had just been  
waiting to see us.

When a boy put a handful of cooked potatoes down my dress and  
there was no water to clean up.

When a soppy poem that I had written to a boy was found and every  
one read it and started teasing me about it.

When my boyfriend asked me to go out with him and I refused  
because I wanted to go out with another guy.  I did go out and my  
boyfriend found out.

The juniors in our dormitory at school started to complain and  
make a lot of noise about the duties assigned to them by the  
prefect who was my class-mate and was very cool and dull.

My elder sister scolded me in front of my younger sisters and  
cousins.  She said that I was very lazy and I felt so sad that I  
cried myself to sleep.

On Christmas day a drunk man came to our house without a shirt  
on, he dansed, spoke nonsense and behaved stupidly.
When I wet my bed at boarding school.

My baby sister was 2-3 months old and when I was trying to get  
her on my back, she slipped and fell.

My son was registered to get admission in grade one of the          
primary school.  The chances of him getting a place there was 1/10.   
Two weeks later I was informed that he had been enrolled.

When I came back from work one day, the friends of my son told me  
that he had not come back from school and that he was lost.

My room-mate locked up our room without specifying where I would  
find the keys.  I had to spend several hours in my other friend's  
room.

The teacher of one course gave me 10 questions with sub-questions  
going from a to e for each question.  She asked me to do all this  
in one and a half hours.  It involved a lot of describing and  
explaining and even though I knew all the answers, I could not  
finish the work.

I forgot that the course instructor had directed us to go for  
special classes after the usual class hours.  I missed this the  
first day and when he asked me about it the next day I said that  
I had forgotten.
When my father bought me a suit.
After having taken an exam i feared having failed it.

I was badly beaten up by one of my friends during a wedding  
party.
I was very sad at hearing that my grandfather had passed away.

I was disappointed by a girlfriend when I visited her at her home  
in Woodlands.

I was caught stealing a box of matches in the supermarket and had  
to plead guilty.
When I heard that I had achieved a place in form I.

Someone stole a K10 note and the teacher thought that it was me  
when I was not responsible for the theft.
When I saw my family after a separation of one year.

When my little sister was sick at home and I thought that she  
would die.

When one of my best friends commited siucide during these  
holidays.

I am disgusted at the number of second year students who are  
pregnant illegitimately.

When my aunt went out of her way to help me out with my financial  
problems.

When I fell in love with "X".  Overnight I felt confidence, self-esteem,     
responsible and worthwhile.

When my room-mate locked me out deliberately, before an exam due  
at 1400 hours.

When my cousin put feaces in my washing.  A silly idea which was  
meant to be a joke.

When I took a small boy's share of choclale.  He was our guest  
and so had been given a larger share of the sweets.

The day I got a telegram telling me that I had been selected for  
a B.A at UNZA.  I felt happy because I had not expected to be  
selected.

When my friends tried to discriminate against my friendship with  
certain other friends which they thought was improper.
The day my teacher of Latin and French died.

The day I went to eat dinner in the dinning hall and found a  
dead fly in my gravy.

I felt ashamed of myself the first time I drank as nobody in the  
family drinks.  I felt that I had let down my parents and my  
friends.
The day I came home drunk after having attended a disco party.

I was very happy when I received the year end results as I was  
worried about how well I had done.  I was very happy to know that I  
had passed.

I told my friend something confidential which was supposed to  
remain between the two of us.  The next thing that happened was  
that a girl who is not even close to us came laughing and askad  
me to tell her about it.  I was very angry with my friend as I  
had trusted her.

I remember that when my mother died the day was sad and every  
time I think of it I am saddened by the loss of my mother.

When thieves broke into our house, I was disgusted by their  
behaviour.  They did not find anything so they broke things like  
the windows, glasses etc.

When I bribed the person who caught me doing something I was not  
supposed to have done.  I was very ashamed of what I had done.

When I received a positive answer from my appeal to withdraw my  
registration at UNZA.
When I learnt of the death of a friend.

When I learnt that my offer to study at the university had been  
withdrawn  and so I would not get hostel accomodation at UNZA,  
even though I registered as a student later.

I came across a blind man sitting in one of the corridors and  
asking for money, though I had some money I did not give him  
anything.

When I was confronted by a policeman one night around 11 o'clock.  
 I was afraid when they threatened to take me and my girl to the  
gallows.

When an argument with a friend of mine over our behaviour towards  
another friend turned into a quarrel.   I lost my temper and nearly  
knocked him out.

When I was denied my favourite dish at the dinning hall (shima  
with roast chicken), I felt disgusted.

When my library books were overdue and I did not have the money  
to pay for them.

When I got my results - I had passed the form III exams.  I had  
not expected to do so well.

When my little brother passed away mysteriously, at least from  
what I was told about it.

When I saw a woman who had been run over by a train, just off  
Kafue.  The woman had been cut to bits, there was blood and         
splinters of bone every where.

When I almost did something awful with a friend of mine and  
myself.

When I "passed out" a female friend of mine for no apparent  
reason.  I was under the influence of drugs and when I am like  
that I get mad at anyone, however small the provocation.
When I was accepted at UNZA.

When my aunt scolded me for something I was not responsible for.   
A boy had come to our gate asking for me, my aunt went out to see  
him.  I had neither met nor known the boy.

When my cousin passed away unexpectedly and tragically (a  
murder).

When my mother got a terrible beating from my father.  It was so  
bad that she fainted and it was only then that my dad realized  
how bad it was.

When I lied at home.   I told them that I was going to a  
Christian meeting and I went to see my boyfriend instead.
Receiving my result slip (pass) on my birthday.

When we forced a friend to chew a poisonous herb in primary  
school.  His tongue was swollen and he told his mother about it.   
The mother reported it to the headmaster who threatened to expel  
us.

At boarding school someone put a lot of tiny thorns on my bed.   
When I complained everybody began teasing me and laughing at my  
inability to find out my enemies.  I lost my temper.
When my grandfather died.

My room-mate was drunk, he vomited on the floor and fell face  
down on the vomit nearly choking himself to death.  Then he  
fainted and so I called the first aid.

As a kid my mother caught me stealing sugar and giving it to a  
neighbour.

I got into a bad fight in a bar and my friend received a bad cut  
above his left eye while trying to separate us.

I felt vvery happy when I was accepted at UNZA for my studies.   
I had not expected this as I had been ill during the exams.

I felt very frightened when a robber broke into our house and  
threatened to shoot my father if he did not part with some money.  
 I was looking at the man with his hand on the trigger.

A teacher at my former secondary school forced my darling to  
marry him.  The girl tried to refuse but her parents would not  
leave her alone.

When my sister died, she was only sixteen when she was put to  
rest.
When I witnessed an accident.

When my father found me in bed with a girl, we were deep in actioon  
when he entered the room.

I took my grandmother's money without telling her and when asked  
if it was me who had taken the money, I denied it.
When I won some coins in a small competion.

This morning during my sleep I had a feeling that someboby was  
attacking me.  I started crying in my sleep and then my room-mate  
woke me up.
When I learnt that my cousin sister was pregnant.

When my dress and a few other things were stolen from my  
wardrobe.
When my grandmother passed away.

When I told a person something that had happened to my friend,  
and this person went and told my friend.

When I got myself the kind of girlfriend I had been hunting for a  
long time.

The time I lost a badminton match, that I should have won at the  
Zambia closed badminton championships.

When I was taking my girlfriend out, she seemed to have taken  
her time.
When my dad caught me with a honey (girlfriend) in my bedroom.

When the university withdrew the accomodation that it had given  
me.

When my mother and father separated (it was a brief separation  
and they are together now).

When I patronized a certain tavern which had prostitutes, it was  
almost a brothel.
When I proposed love to a girl and she turned me down.

When I received a letter from a woman I thought had not ever  
cared for me.  This was when I needed her and I was overjoyed to  
learn that it was me who was delaying things.

I did not like it when a little girl was crying for her dead  
mother and was calling her by her name.  I was sad.

I felt guilty of having suspected my room-mate of stealing the  
money last term.

I had prepared a special meal for my boyfriend but when my  
brother came home he ate it all.  I was really disgusted about it.

I was very happy when my scholarship to continue studying at UNZA  
was approved after it had been cancelled.
When someone took my pen away.

When my cousin passed away during the holidays at home.  He fell  
ill at night and the next day he died in the evening.

An officer at the Dean of students office had promised me to give  
me a room the next day, but he failed to keep his promise.

I do not have accomodation on the campus so I stay with my  
extended family, one young man used bad words while asking me to  
leave their home.
I broke a glass of glycerine at the Z.C.B.C store in Ndola.
When I was with someone I love.
Being made to look like a fool by a girl.
When I was told that I had no right to control my lover.
Getting very low marks in mathematics.
At my sister's wedding.
When I had to walk along a dark road alone.

When I failed one of my courses at school - the university of  
Zambia.
When I swindled money out of someone.
I did not deliver a message on time.

When the lady who is now my wife accepted my proposal to be my  
lover and future wife.

The death of my guardian with whom I had stayed when I did my  
grade six.

When I was substituted in a play which was to be staged, after I  
had learnt all the lines.

When a woman who I respected very much was made pregnant,  
unexpectedly by a man of a caliber I never expected.

When I applied for a false travelling claim allowance and later I  
thought that I would be found out.

I felt happy when my mother gave birth to a son who is the last  
born in the family.

My father had been involved in a car accident two years ago.  I  
was then very scared thinking that he would die as he lay  
unconscious in hospital for two weeks.

I felt very sad when a friend of mine failed the final exam and  
she could not be accepted at the institution of learning.

I felt disgusted when a fellow student asked me to marry him.  I  
had not expected this from him as he was a mere friend.

I was ashamed when my friend and I were cross with each other  
till we apologized to each other.
When I was selected to study here at UNZA.

In 1960,  I was going to a school which was near my village and I  
met a lion on the way, which disappeared suddenly.
When I heard of the death of my mother.

When my relatives troubled me so that I would help them  
financially.
When I failed one of the first year's courses.

When I was late for work and told my boss that it was due to  
transport problem, whereas the truth was that I had woken up  
late.  I thus cheated my boss.

In 1977 when my friend was caught by a crocodile.  We were  
swimming in a river on whose banks our primary school was  
situated.  When my friend was caught, he was on the banks of the  
river and some of us were still in the middle of the river.  I  
was very frightened.

Last academic year I received bad news - my grand-uncle had  
passed away.  I felt lonely and bad because apart from the          
biological ties, he was a good old friend of mine at home.

Last week a former school (secondary) mate of mine, who is now in  
a differentt school came to my room here at UNZA in my absence.   
He was drunk and he vomited in my room.  I was unhappy.

A few years back I had proposed love to a girl who later turned out  
to be related to me.  Though we were in love with each other, we  
both felt ashamed and withdrew from each other.

Last year I was asked to look after my niece while her mother was  
cooking.  Unfortunately the kid fell off the bed, I was confident  
that she would not fall and had not been paying much attention.

When I qualified for form I.  I was one of the three pupils who  
qualified for form I that year.

When I learnt that the girl I had impregnated was in hospital and  
was on the verge of dying as she had refused to accept the  
responsibility of her pregnancy and had wanted to commit suicide.

When I got home I found that the electrical supply had been  
disconnected despite my having paid ZESCO the full bill a few   
days earlier.

When I lost my grandmother.  She had been my guardian after the  
death of my father.

When my demand for accomodation on the campus was refused and the  
rooms were allotted to first year students who were from "Rucher"  
and came from influential families.

When I told the driver at my workplace to lie and tell the boss  
that it was not me who was responsible for the delay.  The boss  
was very annoyed and the driver was punished and a day's salary  
was taken away from him.

When I was taken to the place where my uncle had defecated in his  
pants after having drunk beer.

When it was discovered that I had done the assignment at my work  
place, this caused a lot of embarrassment for me.
When my brother gave me a watch.
Whhen the front tyre of the car burst.
When I was insulted by a fellow student.
When the girl I loved turned me down.
When I found my girl in bed with another man.
When I failed grade 7.

When I passed the first year and so I could come back for my  
second year.

I was working at a certain place and everyday after work dad  
would come to pick me up.  One day he did not come, it started  
getting very dark and I had no money on me and my home was very,  
very far away.

One day I had an appointment with my boyfriend which I had  
objected to in the begining, however he visited me and convinced  
me to come.  The day of the appointment; I had to wait for him  
for over an hour.

When my grandmother passed away.  We had been waiting for it as  
she had been sick for years, but when it happened I found it hard  
to accept.

When my grandmother came to stay with us permanently as she is a  
very difficult person to stay with and when she started telling  
false stories about us to other people.

When I realized that I was pregnant.  I thought about what my  
relatives and friends would think about me and I felt a lot of  
self pity.

One day when I was working, I went out for dinner with friends  
without my parents knowledge and I only came home at 2300 hours.

I was very happy when I found out that I had passed with flying  
colours and that I had made it to the university.

Last night, I dreamt that things that looked like monsters were  
trying to kiss me.

One of these people who sell meat in town used a knife to stab  
his friend and later carried on using the same knife to cut meat.

This is a kind of confession - my mum found me stealing meat from  
the pot.
The first time I really fell in love with a girl.

The time I drove my uncle's car, without having asked for his  
permission.  It was the first time that I was driving a car.
When my kid brother broke my reading spectacles.
