When my mum's brother passed away after having been involved in a  
car accident.   He was bringing me a present as I had passed my  
form five exams with flying colours.
When I, for the first time, failed a junior exam, i.e form 3.
When I nearly got my fiancee pregnant.

When my sister's first child came home, after one week in  
intensive care at the hospital.

When I was at a boarding school at Lusaka, the Rhodesian  
soldiers came to bomb a house near our school and we saw the  
whole scene.

A very close friend of mine was refused entrance to the medical  
school.  Her grades were very good and she should not have been  
left out.  Biased judgment !

My sister lost one of her twin sons (my first nephews) and then  
the older one died a week later.

When I went to report a stolen good at the police station, the  
woman-officer-in-charge was very rude and did not seem to have  
respect for anyone.

I insulted two of my friends because I thought that had been  
gossiping about me right under my nose, however I later found out  
that they were not doing so.

I failed to keep a promise and this had a serious effet on someone's  
problem.

When my neighbour's life was threatened by someone who was trying  
to break into his house.

When a boy who was drunk came into my room and misbehaved in the  
presence of my boyfriend.

When the committee, to which I belong, was accused of having  
squandered the money of the association.

When I went to the library three weeks after it had opened and  
found that everyone was busy.
When my friend was punished for something that I had done.

One evening when my sisters, brothers and I were watching T.V my  
kid brother took a big mirror and reflected light on the french  
windows.  I thought that these lights that we could see were  
coming from torches annd that it meant that there were thieves  
outside.
A break-up with someone I really liked.
I was wearing a slit tight dress at a disco and it burst open.
When I accepted Jesus Christ as my personal saviour.

When I witnessed a bus accident in which a bus, full of passengers,  
 nearly overturned on the Lusaka-Kabwe road.

When my sister came home late one day and thus disobeyed my  
parents.
When I heard the news of my grandfather's sudden death.
When I failed the  grade 7 exams.
When I hurt my sisters for no reason at all.

When I received my results and found out that I could not go to a  
school of my choice.

When I found a maggot in my food at the dinning hall, all the  
food had gone bad.

An item which belonged to a friend of mine was missing.  I had  
taken it earlier and I thought that I had returnrd it so when he  
asked me for it I stubbornly refused having it.  Later when I  
looked for it, I found it in my room.
When I got my results ( I had made it to the second year ).
When I thought that I had failed the examination.
When my grandfather died.

When I heard that my sister had shouted at my friend's cousin at  
their place.

When my girl told me that she loved me more than any male  
creature on earth and that I would be the only one in her heart  
for all her life.

When someone I love told me that she did not love me anymore and  
that she wanted all the snaps that she had given me in exchange  
for the ones I had given her.

When a girl said in my back that we were in love, and she had  
actually refused me.  When I confronted her she started insulting  
me.
When I learnt that I had been accepted at UNZA.

When thieves broke into my house at night and held my wife and me  
on gun-point for at least ten minutes and took away a lot of  
property.

When I received the news that my in-laws had passed away.  I  
depended heavily on them for their guidance and the running of  
their daughter's buisness.

When my younger sister visited me during the school holidays and  
told me that she would not go back to school because she was  
pregnant.

When I lied to my wife and told her that I was going to the  
Copperbelt on a buisness trip, she later found me in a hotel with  
a girlfriend.

When I cheated my father and told him that the school  
administration wanted K80 for the purchase of a mini-bus.  Two  
months later the school authorities wrote back to my father for  
the money.  I could not go back and ask him for the money again  
as he had already given it to me once.

A certain boy came into my room and started telling me that I was  
not pretty, that I had no manners and that I should learn some.   
I had just come to campus and he was in fourth year.

My elder sister whom I love very much was leaving for the           
West Indies for two years and I was staying behind.

A certain girl asked me what my major was and when I told her  
that it was P.A she started criticizing it saying, "I hate that  
course."  She just shows off in front of other people.

I told my elder brother that he was irresponsible and that I did  
not care for what he did because he was teasing me.

When I was selected to this university despite my having  
studyied in difficulty throughout my secondary school days.

The day I learnt that my girlfriend had been going around with  a  
close friend of mine.

I was drunk one night and I insulted three ladies.  The following  
morning they approached me and asked me the reason behind my  
bahaviour, I apologized for my unruly behaviour.

I felt happy when I learnt that I had qualified for the grade  
eight.

I was afraid when I learnt that my father was seriously ill in  
hospital.
When I met my new girlfriend with another man in the street.

When I learnt that my brother-in-law had been poisoned by his  
friends and that he was dead.

When I discovered that the girl I was courting was a relative of  
mine.
When the robbers broke in, at night.

I wrote an assignment and was given less marks than a friend with  
whom I had previously discussed the assignment.
When I got a message that my child was not feeling well.

When I was teaching a student started making silly remarks in  
class.

When I was in grade one, one day I felt like going to the toilet  
during class but I was very scared of the teacher so I urinated  
in the class.

The day my parents were involved in a car accident and had to be  
operated  and before the operation the doctor said that it was  
mater of life or death.

I got into an argument with a photographer for whom I had to pose  
twelve times, over  a period of four weeks, before I could get a  
snap of mine.  Every time the film was processed my snap did not  
come out although the others did.

I was sad at the expulsion of some of my comrades during the UNZA  
demonstrations.

I had a feeling of shame when I found myself unable to answer  
some questions from my tutor simply because of a lack of  
preparation.
The same as in SHAME.

On a road trip with a group of sorority and fraternity people, I  
became intoxicated and basically raped. I don't remember the  
actual event, but I know the feeling that I experienced later.

When I got fired from a job because I gave a discount to a  
friend.
Our basketball team is undefeated in league play (4-0) currently.
Whenever I think of enrolling in Organic Chemistry.

When I felt powerless to help the poor or when I don't know how  
to.

I felt disgusted at my teams poor perfomance prior to league  
play.

I was walking home from a place on southside and I live on  
Northside and I was followed. I headed my most direct route.

Someone signed up for a workshift at the co-op where I live and  
she did not want to work the switchboard. I became very angry.  
She had mentioned earlier that she wanted and needed the  
workshift to me so I did not sign up.

I did not do as well as I expected on a chemistry exam. I  
received a score below the average and I thought I had done very  
well.

I blew up at someone for being confused and because of his  
irresponsibility and afterwards I felt guilty and that I had no  
right.

I was river rafting in Nev. and our boat tipped over and I was  
sucked under in to some rocks and got stuck and all I could think  
was that I was going to die. And it was so quiet under the water  
it seemed like no one would care or remember.

One of my first boyfriends got mad at me because a lot of my  
close friends were guys and he didn't want me to see them anymore  
because he was jealous.

I was watching a sunset after my latest boyfriend left me and I  
realized that we would never watch sunsets again, probaly never  
see eachother again and none of it mattered.

I was listening to a priest in church saying how sinful man was,  
and how all men should renounce their desires and pleasures to  
please God. I could never understand how something that brings you  
joy could be a sin.

My third grade teacher caught me cheating on a spelling test. I  
couldn't spell Australia and she said in a loud voice something  
like "We don't have cheaters in my class".

When I was 5, a few of my friends and I would light matches for  
fun. One of my friends confessed to her parents and my parents, I  
guess, knew or suspected I was involved but I said I knew  
nothing about it.

I experienced anger most recently when I had committed a sin  
which I had gone a week and a half without doing. I had made a  
vow to God and had blown it. Now I had to start all over.

I last really felt sad when I left home for I was leaving all my  
long time, pre-kindergarten relationships behind.
When I committed the sin of immorality mentioned before.
Finally being asked by someone to a banquet.

A few weeks back, as I was in a hurry to leave the house, I left  
some of my things lying around.  This is something I never do. My  
uncle,who lives with us, as we live in a joint family, remarked that  
we were always doing things like  this.  This really got me mad.

A girlfriend of mine behaves in a very childish way - she does  
not like my going to see a friend who has been introduced to me  
by this same friend of mine.  I would like to be friends with  
both of them, but she does not like this as she is possessive and  
would like me to be close only to her.

A friend of mine had said something about not liking to come to  
my place just before coming to my place.   In the meanwhile I got  
to learn about this from another friend of mine and when she  
arrived at my place I really treated her badly.  I was later  
ashamed of the way I had treated someone when the person was at  
my place.

A few days back my mother was not feeling too well and still did  
all the house work.  I felt guilty as I had not offered to help.
I was scared of water when I was a child.
When I get home late my father scolds me and this makes me angry.
When my aunt died.

A friend of mine remembered me when she needed me and did not  
even think about me when she did not need me.
When I got 1 mark in an Abnormal Psychology exam.
[ I have not felt this emotion.]

When I passed the B.A exams with 1st class.  I was the first in  
the family to have got a 1st class, so all the family members  
were very happy and they gave me the opportunity to study  
further.

When I dreamt that my family was in trouble and was facing many  
difficulties.

When my brother got very low marks in the exams, I was very angry.  
I put my studies aside to help him, as every time my brother does   
badly at school, my family members blame me as well.

[ When family mmembers or friends blame me for something I am not  
responsible for.  I feel very sad as it was not my fault.]

[ I feel disgust at people lying.  It means that they say one  
thing to one person and the same thing in another way to another  
person and this makes people quarrel among themselves.]

When my pet dog,who was to us a family member, died.  He had been  
vomitting for the past three days and we had not found the time  
to call a vet, finally when the vet came it was already too late.

When last year in college I received the award "Best Student of the Year",  
  I felt very happy as I got what I had wanted and my wish had  
been fulfilled.

Once I woke up in the middle of the night and felt frightened as  
everyone else was sleeping and I could not even go to their  
room.

[ It irritates me when people talk about me behind my back.  I     
prefer people to tell me what they have to, on my face instead  
of talking behind my back.]
[ When friends and colleagues talk bad about me.]

At work when I did not get the full co-operation of my colleagues  
to complete an assignment.
[ When I acted against my mind or conscious.]

In the begining of teenage, on the matters of sex - speaking  
about sex.

In 1980 when I was in the 12th standard, we had arranged a small  
picnic in Kandala.  One of my closest friends wrote a small and  
cute poem for me, which expressed the feeling of closeness we had  
for each other.  I was very thrilled and I can still remember it.

One night we, all the family members, were sitting in the front  
corridor of the house when a gentleman looking person came in.   
He was my father's client and he had come to bribe my father in  
connection with the proceeding case.  At my father's refusal he  
abused my father, my brother and I could not control our temper  
and we rushed at him.

Once my friend and I got into into a hot discussion on a very  
controversial topic.  At one point of the argument I disagreed  
with her totally and I took what she was saying as an insult.  So  
I couter-argued and unknowingly hurt her emotionally, I felt very  
sad about this.

I met my friend and he gave me a wonderful present as it was my  
birthday.  I enjoyed having that present.

When I lost a wallet while travelling, since it belonged to the  
group I was very afraid.

My notes were not returned to me, it kept on being  
procrastinated.
I was misbehaving in the agency.
When going to the exam.
[ When I do not get any co-operation from my friends/partners.]
When my brother's visa for the U.S.A got cancelled.

I had known the girl for a few months when I proposed to her and this  
put an end to our friendship, as from then on we started  
withdrawing from each other.  I liked her very much.

When my elder sister had a baby girl.  She was the first girl in  
the family after 19 years of baby boys.

When our school was raided by the pupils of the boys secondary  
school who beat us up.

When I received the news that my beloved grandmother had died.  I  
was at the boarding school and was only 13 years old.

One evening when a boy who was drunk made a pass at me by trying  
to kiss me.

When I blurted out an answer in class without having been asked  
to do so.  The teacher told me that it was bad manners to do so.

When I had promised to do some washing for my mother and I did  
not do it.  She did it herself despite her being ill.  I felt  
very guilty.

I was very happy when I passed and went to form I.  It was a  
great relief for me as I had been very worried considering the  
large number of pupils who fail.

During the last academic year i.e 1983/1984 just before the  
closure, we were surrounded and threatened by the paramilitary  
forces.
When someone I trusted very much, disappointed me.

When a close friend of mine who was with me in first year could  
not make it to the second year.
When one of my friends started misbehaving.

When I failed one of the tests because I had not worked hard  
enough.
When I was scolded by my dad for bad behaviour.

After waiting impatiently for the results of the form 5  
examinations for almost a year, at last I received a letter of  
acceptance from the Senate of the university of Zambia telling  
me that I had made it to the first year course at UNZA.

The first day that I was close to a dead body, in my third year  
at UNZA, school of medicine.

A few monthe ago, when my brother's wife told me that I had bad  
manners.  To make matters worse she did not let me use their  
telephone as she only allowed people of her own tribe.

I was saying bad things about a man I had never seen.  I was  
with a friend and did not know that she was related to this man.   
My friend did not tell me about it and I discovered this myself.

When I received the first year results as the first year had  
involved a lot of work and I was very pleased when I got the  
results.

When a boy, who was drunk, insulted me in front of a crowd.  I  
was stopped from punching him for it.

When I heard the news that my brother had passed away.  It was  
the first time that I lost a brother.

When my mother found me in her bedroom "stealing" sugar in her  
bedroom.  According to our customs there comes a stage when a  
child stops using the parents bedroom and I was well past that  
age.

The computer at school had left out my name along with four  
others and I had no rights for one year.  So I was happy to find  
my name on the medical schhol list.

I had gone on a vacation and my mother left home without leaving  
me any thing - money to come back to school.
I remember being sad whe my aunt's child died (2 days old).

I was eating in the dinning hall and some women joined me.  I  
could not eat with them so I left the dinning hall.

I was about to share lunch with my aunt's husband when she told  
me that I would have to wait and eat with my cousins.

When my friends and I were caught with our girlfriends outside  
the school grounds when I was at the secondary school.  We were  
caught by the headmaster.

A friend gave me a lift and we met a road-block.  He tried  to  
turn back when an officer shouted at us to stop.  My friend took a  
turn suddenly and the officer raised his gun but by the time we  
were gone.

I had a misunderstanding with my father and after some time I  
found that I had been wrong.

A very close friend of mine invited me to spend the holidays with  
him.  He was very kind, good and understanding.  However it  
turned out that he had two of his cousins at his place.  He,  
however gave me everything I needed - even transport money.

When my girl and I decided to get back together after our  
separation.

I was so sick that my relatives thought that I was bewitched.  I  
felt like dying.

When my girlfriend left me to go out with another guy, even  
though she knew that she was wrong.
When I failed my first biochemistry test.
When I bought new clothes and put them on.
When I went to my first dental appointment.

When my girlfriend was afraid and anxious the day before taking  
her exam.

When my room-mate made a mess of the room after having drunk the  
whole night at a graduation party ceremony.
When I did not inform my friends of my forthcoming birthday.

After I reluctantly refused to dine with a certain man on the  
same table.

When my elder brother, who had gone abroad to study  for six  
years, came back home safe and in good health.

When I entered the dissecting room for the anatomy class and saw  
several dead bodies lying on the benches.

I was in love with a very beautiful girl and when I went back for  
my holidays I found her wth another guy who she said was just a  
friend.  Later I found them together and was convinced that there  
was something fishy.

When I went to see the dead body of my uncle.  This was a very  
dramatic expreience as it was the first time that I entered a  
mortuary.

When the brother-in-law of a girlfriend of mine found us in a  
bedroom with clothes and panties spread all over the place.

The first time that I "played with myself" despite being a  
Christian.  I had read in the bible that it was wrong to make  
love to someone one is not married to.

When I entered the dissection room for the first time and was  
exposed to preserved dead human bodies.

When I learnt that my younger sister had been expelled from  
secondary school because she was pregnant.  That was the second  
time that this happened in the family - the first time it had  
been my elder sister.

When I realized that I was in hospital after a car accident and  
that I had a scleral tear in my left eye.

When I realized that not all my friends like the comments that I  
pass in their presence.

When I was accepted into the medical school.  Medicine is a  
profession that I have desired ever since my childhood.

When the time came for me to see dead bodies and to operate on  
them.

When I was accused of having planned my friend's outing at  
secondary school (boarding) as we were not allowed to go out.

When I realized the burden it was for my mother to look after all  
of us, all by herself.

When I heard that a woman of my community had aborted and got rid  
of the foetus by throwing it in the drain.

When I blamed my failure to the bias and favouritism in the         
marking system, in fact I had not worked hard enough.

When my friend ended up pregnant by a gentleman whom I considered  
to be good and faithful but he ended up neglecting her and not  
bothering about her.

When I heard that I had been selected fot the first year at the  
university of Zambia.  This was after my form five at Chikola  
secondary school.

When I took the first year university exams and made a lot of  
mistakes in the P110 exam.  I was afraid of failing and thus  
being unable to go to the school of medicine.

When my brother-in-law's brother stole my clothes when my  
brother-in-law and I had gone to cut wood for the fire.

When I was accused of having impregnated someone's daughter, it  
was the girl's cousin who had done it.

When my darling found me walking hand in hand with another girl  
whom I loved also.

When I told my uncle a false story - that people had stolen the  
books from my room and I demanded money from him.  When he found  
out the truth I was in trouble.
When I won the best prize in the National science fair.
When I was chased by a big dog near my house.
When my grandmother died - having to see my mother weep.

When I had to walk home from the bus-stop in a skirt that I had  
soiled.  It drew a lot of attention and they all seemed to want  
to see the blood stains.
When I overate at lunch.

When I heard the examination results and when I recovered after  
having been sick for a week.

When my mother was seriously ill and had to be admitted to the  
hospital.

When someone took my things without having asked for my  
permission.
When my father passed away.

When I went to the clinic for a medical check-up and saw the way  
the lecturer was conducting the lecture and the kind of responses  
he got from the patients.

When I did something naughty and it lead to the embarrassment of  
my parents.
When I lied to the physiology teacher.
When I learnt that I had been accepted at the medical school.

While drinking a soft drink, I had the impression of swallowing    
a piece of glass so I went to the district hospital and got  
admitted there.
I witnessed a scene in which two women were abusing each other.

I was to take a test and I had not made the necessary preparations  
until it was too late.  There were two days to go and I still had  
not done much.
When I was selected to the university of Zambia.
When my father was involved in an accident.
When a few girls were talking rubbish about me.
When my beloved uncle was shot dead by relatives.

When I failed the entrance exam of the medical school and was  
studying biochemistry which has no job prospects in Zambia.
When my sister became pregnant at UNZA last year.
When I got very drunk and really misbehaved at Christmas.

When I was offered a place in the university as a full time  
student.

When I was first exposed to the dead bodies, for dissecting         
purposes at the school of medicine.

When my father was imprisoned for burning the house of his  
younger brother.

When my elder brother failed form five in 1968 when I was 5 years  
old.
When I heard that I had passed the second year exams.

When I was about to be bitten by my friend's dog, later on it bit  
me.

When I heard that an acquaintance of mine was spreading rumours  
about my affair with a close friend.

When a close friend of mine collapsed and passed away and the  
illness was not known.
When I failed the grade seven exams.

When I forgot to cook something that my mother had told me to,  
and at supper time the food that I was supposed to have prepared  
was not there.
When I qualified for form I.

When I was going home for my holiday, I almost drowned in the  
Zambezi river.

When the paramilitary was sent to the UNZA and it started using  
tear gas and started intimidating the students without any  
provocation.
When my grandfather died.
When my parents insisted that I take up a teaching career.

When I beat up my brother so badly, for not having gone to school,  
that we had to take him to hospital.

I was walking along the passage to my room (very near the anatomy  
laboratory) and I heard something and felt that there was some  
thing behind me.  I looked back and there was no one.  I started  
imagining that maybe it was a corpse.
When my brother (5th in the family) passed away.

As a young girl in form I, I wet my bed one day at the boarding  
school and many girls came to see the person who had done it as I  
had to take my mattress out that day.
When my sister was very ill and was admitted to the hospital.

When my father failed to send me transport money after the  
closure of the school.

When my parents separated temporarily and I was left behind with  
my father.  As I loved my mother I wanted to go with her.

A few weeks back I received a Christmas card from a friend in  
England.  She had not written to me in a very long time but it      
showed that she still remembered me.

The first time that I saw a dead person.  This was when I started  
my gross anatomy practicals.

I once failed a test miserably and my friend did very well and  
someone made a nasty comment while comparing me to my friend.

A friend of mine got pregnant anf failed the first year at  
university.  The boyfriend refused his responsibility and they  
ended up in court.

I once saw an elderly lady who was not properly dressed.  She was  
wearing a transparent dress, such things are not sopposed to be  
seen in African society.
During my childhood I once lied and my sister found out.
When I was left alone at home one night by my brother.

The government's announcement of the withdrawal of the student  
allowances in 1984.
When I first suffered from syphilis.
Being mistreated by my former primary school teacher, Mr Zalu.
Lying to my cousin about the form five examination fees.

In September 1984 I got two girls pregnant and the families of  
both the girls confronted me .  The fact was that my parents were  
around and I felt guilty answering some of the questions.

When one of my closest friends failed to make it to the third  
year of university.

When I had to talk to some strangers, from whom I was expecting a  
negative answer.
[ When some difference of opinion occurs in a silly situation.]

I felt disgusted when we (family) avoided a problem which could  
be solved readily.

[ I feel shame when I do not arrive on time and others have to  
wait for me for a long time.]
When I got engaged to a boy of my choice.
When I saw the movie "Poltergist".
When my grandfather died.
When I passed my B.A exams.
[ While approaching to test the situation.]

When my boyfriend told me that it would be difficult for him to  
marry me.

I felt very disgusted at a friend to whom I had given a Psychology  
book to read, and she did not care to give me back the book  
during the exams.

When an intimate friend of mine passed B.A with first class and I  
got only pass class.
Mentioning a book to the person who borrowed it.
Being chosen to do this experiment.
Finding out about people can go mad for social reasons.
My article not chosen by the college newspaper
I did not do my homework and went to see a film.
Doing well in the examn.
A relative died.
Bad food in the students' dining hall.
Could not get into the university I wanted to get in.
Noisy people in the library.
Meeting other friends who got in the good universities.
Telling my parents that I did not get into a good university.
Before the first examn.
Someone messing up the room we share.
Some students trying to please the lecturer.
Not chosen for all English classes.
Reading a nice book and talking about it to my friend.
Insulted by the class leader.

Too busy to write letters to friends and they said I had  
forgotten about them.
Going to a concert.
Broken a friend's cup.
Good dinner on the National Day.
Saw a snake unexpectedly.
Seeing this badly made questionnaire.
You ignored the fact that we could not hear you at the back.
Failing an examn.
Watching the Asian Olympic game (China winning).

People having a football match outside the window during the  
lecture.

China can not even give you good sound systems for an open  
lecture.
Not being able to hand in homework in time.
Thinking about other things in a lecture.
Got a big fish in fishing.
Heard some ghost-like noise at night.
A father helping his kid to fight other kids.
A father of 4 children killed in an accident.

When the student union leaders were expelled from the university  
and we continued to study.

When I was watching a movie in which there was a pit full of  
dangers and there was only a small safe place on which a man was  
standing; he had to catch the lady who was thrown in or else !  
The pit was 20 feet deep.

My mother and my sister carried on picking at me all day long for  
no reason at all and I ended up getting angry.

When my boyfriend almost had a relationship with a close friend  
of mine.

When a classmate of ours knocked on our door at 2 o'clock in the  
morning.  I was disgusted at his behaviour.

I told a lie about someone to someone else and they found out    
and questioned me about it.

At church camp when I accepted Christ into my life and so did my  
friend.

I was complaining about calling people whom I didn't know. I  
forgot that the purpose is to invite people for dinner and get to  
know them.

Whenever I see poverty and starvation. I live in an affluent  
society and am privileged to have many opportunities.

English papers are due on Friday. They are returned on Tuesday.  
This Tuesday I was afraid to go to class and get my paper because  
I knew it was bad.

A friend of mine came to visit and stayed with my roommate and me.  
My roommate and she became good friends. After she left, he  
didn't talk too highly of her.
After receiving the grade on the paper mentioned in FEAR.
Seeing a person panhandling money on Telegraph.
After the car accident in GUILT.

The night of a high school dance, I went partying and collided  
with another car. Both cars were totalled; people were injured  
but not seriously.
When seeing a friend that I had not seen in a long while.
Fear of doing well on a midterm.

When my grandmother after staying with us for awhile went back  
home.

I felt disgust as a result of one of my midterms - I thought I  
had prepared well for it, but the end result wasn't what I had  
expected.

I felt shame when I saw someone I knew and pretended not to see  
her. Later she saw me and said hi.

In neglecting some work that had to be done around the house and  
telling my roommate I would get it done.

Going to Cowell Hospital and finding out tediously that I had a  
stress fracture. The anger came when the senile doctors found out  
4 weeks later that I had 2 stress fractures in one foot and  
should have had crutches. I was in distinct pain and barely could  
walk to classes. They said it would be better in 2 weeks.

Seeing a friend "making love" to a high school girl. I  
accidentally was dragged into this room where the happenings had  
occurred. I was disgusted at the reality.

After moving out of my apt. I took all the furniture and dishes  
and everything. It was mine but I took it all just to spite my  
roomies. We had a few (a lot) of disagreements. I felt guilt for  
moving out for the bad reasons.

It was the weekend of my homecoming. I saw my sister for the  
first time in 3 months. She's my best friend and extremely close.

After my shoulder operation, I woke up in the hospital room  
alone. I was in pain and was still under heavy medications. I  
could not find my parents.

When I found out my cousin had been killed. I was angry at the  
world, and her murderer who was her ex-boyfriend. It was the worst  
and most hateful day of my life.

I spent a weekend in San Diego visiting my boyfriend Rob. We were  
at the airport and my plane was just about so leave. After saying  
goodbye, I boarded the plane. It was the hardest thing to do and  
it was a sad trip home.

I caught a "peeping tom" at my window when I was getting  
undressed.

Saying goodbye at the airport to my boyfriend who has to go to  
school back East. We are very close and have been together 4  
years.

My parents claimed me on their income tax after I had been out of  
the house for two years receiving no financial support from them.  
As result I had to work more during school because they were  
expected by the FAO to contribute to my education when they  
refuse to do so.

I was wearing a short skirt one day and someone told me my  
underwear was showing.

Getting a D in a class last semester and knowing it was because I  
didn't study.

Went to a movie with a date, walked on the beach (in Alameda)  
spent some time afterwards in her apt.

I am currently taking CS 50P. I had to finish a couple of  
assignments but I was hindered because I could not get a passing  
score on my program.
The girl I was seeing didn't want to have a serious relationship.

I found out that someone that I knew had someone else taking  
tests for her.

One night a friend found out that I dumped one girl for another  
and he proceded to lecture me.
I called off a relationship with one girl so I could see another.

During a dance someone slashed my tires and dumped paint on my  
car. I had four other friends with me that I drove and  
furthermore it was raining.

When I was trying for a girl who I really liked and cared for and  
thought she felt the same way too. But she didn't like the idea  
and just wanted to stay friends.

When I lose on my bets on anything - baseball, football,  
basketball, track, craps, poker, or arcade - whether its 5  
dollars or 200 I feel that I should never have done it in the  
first place.

My mom told me not to gamble, but I did anyway. Sometimes I would  
even take some money from my parents and brother. She found out  
and yelled at me.
Finished a difficult midterm.
Saw a scene in a movie implying incest as humorous.

When given responsibility to grade papers in elementary school, I  
cheated a little and graded my own higher.
Did very, very well on a Physics midterm.

Alone in the house (late 8pm) I heard noises. Sounded like someone  
was trying to get in our back door.

A friend doesn't let me study when I want to. She doesn't feel I  
need to study and doesn't understand how important studying is to  
me. I get very angry with her.

Death of a pet rabbit. We had to give it away because my brother  
became allergic to it. We gave it to a man who kept animals and  
lots of other animals for children to watch. We went to visit our  
rabbit. It was badly beaten by the other rabbits and eventually  
died.

When I stand at the bus stop for one hour waiting for the bus to  
arrive.

When I sat in the wrong discussion section in the beginning of  
the semester. I insisted on being in the right section and the  
TA's list should have included my name. When I found out that I  
was in the wrong, I apologized, turned red and left.

About not helping my sister when she asked me to help her on her  
chemistry class. I pretended to be busy.
When I won my car.
Going to take my driving test.

I came home one day and discovered that my sister had borrowed my  
car and had gotten into an accident with it. My entire front  
bumper was destroyed.
When I heard the news that my grandfather had died.

When I purposely locked my babysitter out of the house at age 4  
because I DIDN'T LIKE HER.
When I did not go to work because I had to study for a midterm.

At a party in which I met an interesting female. We enjoyed  
eachothers company, while slow dacing.

A friend and I were going to have a study session together in  
which we quiz ourselves in biology material. Because I believed I  
didn't study enough. I feared I would fail.

I live with my sister now and sometimes she angers me especially  
when she thinks I don't keep the apt. clean enough.

When I found out that I could not go to the concert (after buying  
the tickets) because of a biology test which occurred the morning  
after.

Right now I volunteer at a hospital. Yesterday, Halloween, I  
dressed up as a doctor and went to work. The volunteer  
coordinator told me after my shift that it was dangerous to have  
done what I did.

When I get an exam back with a grade that I did not desire. Then  
I get mad at myself and say that I could have done better.

After days or weekends where I did not accomplish the amount of  
sudying that I wanted to because of more pleasant activities  
which come up.

Last semester when I dated a girl whom I've known for almost a  
year. However one night she said she wanted us to be "just  
friends". I confided this to a friend Jim I was really suffering.  
A month or two later he broke up with his old girlfriend and they  
started going out regularly. I have no girlfriend nor have I had  
a romantic relationship of any significance. I feel some anger  
but we are friends again.

I was angry about 3 months ago and I kicked backwards against the  
wall. It caved in and so I had to show it to my parents. I had  
been angry after my mother said something to me about not being  
able to find clothes in my size - something that I'm sensitive  
about. (6' 5'' 210)
Someone (a boy) paid special attention to me.
Getting back my Psych 140 midterm.

My roommate leaving my drawers in a mess after plowing thourgh  
them looking for something.

A friend of mine had sex with someone of a different race on a  
Winnebago trip down to USC in front of everyone (all my friends  
embarrassed my sorority house name).

When I lied to my best friend about a boy she really liked but he  
didn't like her. I told her he did and she bugged him for a long  
time embarrassing herself.

I'm allergic to most foods - eating something that I'm allergic  
to caused guilt.
A certain night during initiation.

When someone threw a firecracker into my room at 7:00 am in the  
morning.
A close friend of the family died.
Not doing my share of the work for the house job.

I received an unexpected B+ on an engineering midterm. I did not  
study nearly as much as I should have and it was a difficult  
test.
I could not do the questions on my math midterm.

I was supposed to meet my girlfriend at a pre-arranged place but  
it took me an hour to find her.
I saw part of a Prince video with him crawling out of a bath tub.

I slammed my little brother into a wall because he was bothering  
me.

When I found out that my good friend and roommate did not pay the  
phone bill and electric bill like he promised and let me down.

When I found out that my girlfriend would not be coming back to  
UCB for one semester, but would be living in San Jose.

When I was about 17 years old and I stole some pens from a  
stationery store because I didn't have enough money.
First day back on the job.

When the person I'm having the affair with won't talk to me in  
public.

Having an affair with my good friend's best friend. And every time  
I see my best friend I feel guilt because we can't tell him.
When  fell in love with my present girlfriend.

When people would tell me that my ex-girlfriend was playing  
around on me.

When I study my butt off for a midterm and still get an average  
grade.
When I was 10, I got busted for stealing a candy-bar.
When I copy someone else's problem set.
I got a very good grade on one of my midterms a few weeks ago.

My mom called early in the morning (On a Monday) and I had just  
seen her that weekend. I couldn't understand what could be so  
important as to make her call at such a strange hour. I missed  
the call and had to call her back that afternoon.

My peers didn't want me to meet someone during rush for fear that  
I would give her a bad outlook on our Sororoty house. I shouldn't  
have seen this, but they blew and I did.
Doing poorly on a midterm.
My boat didn't win a race which we were favored to win.
Sleeping through crew practice one Monday morning.

When I had achieved a goal indirectly. I work for CAL Football  
and our 2nd win of the season was very gratifying and brought  
our joy because of the hard work involved and the fact that no  
one expected we would win.

I had worked long and hard on a project when a friend  
inadvertantly destroyed it. I could not forgive him for a long  
time. And at times still get angry at him.

When a pet died. The pet was the closest friend I had for 15  
years.

When people/press analyze a particular newsworthy item (CAL  
Football team) which I am a member and can only see the situation  
in a bad light and always put the team down.

I felt guilty when I mislead a person into thinking he was a  
close friend when that person was more of a casual acquaintance.
Getting my accentance letter from CAL.

At the end of my senior yr. in high school I found out that a  
friend of mine I knew had cancer had been diagnosed as terminally  
ill.

I slipped on butter one evening in the Dining Commons landed on  
my rear causing my tray also to land on the floor.

A person I was attracted to walked me home in the rain and got  
sick.

Today I did a lot better on my architecture project than I  
expected.

When I was little I lost control of my bike and started to go  
into a buay intersection but my neighbor stopped me just in time.

This monday I took a Math 1BS test and flunked for the second  
time.
When I found out the CIA was mining Nicaraguan harbors.

A month ago I turned in an English paper in late after I had  
already had a previous paper late and promised not to do it  
again.

I forgot my mother's and sister's birthdays (they fall on the  
same day).
When I received a letter of acceptance to CAL.

A time when I was very afraid of something was when I broke my  
father's antique lamp.
When someone told a secret I told them not to tell.
When my mother was very sick and almost died.
When I saw President Reagan get elected.
When I failed some tests my first year at CAL.
When I stole something.
I gave my mom a gift she wanted for years. I raflected her joy.

Walking through campus at night a squirrel jumped in front of  
me.

After a long trip in my dad's van without incident I stopped to  
fill the tank with gas and dented the side of the van against the  
pole. Then my cars electrical system would not work when I tried  
to drive home from his house.

At one point in a relationship, my boyfriend was seeing an old  
flame more than me. At our confrontation tears were shed.
When a skunk invaded camp.

I mangled the side of my dad's van on a fence. I did not realize  
the extent of the damage until he showed it to me the next day.  
The shock on my face was genuine so a friend interceded with a  
good excuse which I did not deny. I never clarified the  
situation.

When I finally got a job after days of wondering whether I would  
be hired or not and counting on the money that it would bring.

A time when, as part of my work, I was sent out actually sort of  
volunteered to run an errand for someone who had no authority to  
send me out and the address was very far especially on foot and  
turned out to be incorrect too. The whole trip was a waste.
When my roommate forgets to flush the toilet.

When I did poorly on a test and I knew that there wasn't an  
excuse for not doing better. Made mistakes I could not believe I  
made.

Remembering (at the time I did not feel guilt) in recent yrs. how  
angry I would get when I was babysitting my new brother and he  
would not stop crying. I did not do anything harmful or shocking.  
But I feel guilty for treating him the way I did especially  
since I adore him now. That's why I spoil him now.

Yesterday when I received a B on a history midterm. I felt  
overjoyed after having received C's previously.

A month ago when one of my fellow workers got a promotion over  
me. It was just a small promotion but recognition was involved.

When another fellow worker decided to leave the company. We had  
been very close and we would not be able to work with eachother  
any longer.

When I had not been accepted to a college which I dreamed of  
going to. I felt that I had let myself and my parents down.

When I drove partially across the country with my father. We  
stopped in a few towns and stayed overnight in motels. The joy I  
got was from the feedom I felt and the real beauty of the  
country.

One day before Christmas, I went shopping with my brother and his  
friend. We had a good time. But on the way home we were almost in  
an accident because the weather was bad.

I can't remember being truly angry. Usually it's just  
disappointment that I feel. One situation would be with my  
brother. He and I used to be close but now he seems to be  
avoiding me.

4 years ago my family decided to move from New York to  
California. From the time we decided to move until the time we  
left, I realized how much my friends cared for me. When we left  
and for a long time after that I was very sad.

Once when I was babysitting for some neighbors children I found  
roaches in ther bathroom. I had never seen a roach before but I  
called my mother to make sure that's what they were. And she came  
over and checked.

The first time I slept at my boyfriends house and had to walk  
down the hall to the shower in front of his housemates. I felt  
they were judging me.
The last time I had sex.

Physically fighting with my girlfriend because she just walked  
out of a room of my friends and had pushed and cursed at me when  
I went to find her.

Hearing about a friend back home that had to have his stomach  
pumped because he had overdosed on pills.

After learning on the news about this man who killed more than  
300 women and habitually copulated into their inert bodies.
I had just masterbated with another boy.

Going out with another girl besides my girlfriend and not telling  
her.

Reading a letter from a close friend who said he missed me and  
cared for me.
Going to CAL not knowing anyone.
Leaving high school.

When my roommate came home at 10 in the morning after sleeping  
with a guy she did not know because she got drunk. (Se has a  
boyfriend too).
Fooling around with this guy I did not know.
Not noticing my roommates quietness or a sign of discomfort.
I went home and visited with my family and friends.

While I was away for the weekend some friends went into my room  
and played my very expensive stereo without asking me or my  
roommate.
I asked a girl out on a date and she said no.

I was playing a sport in an advanced PE class and many of the  
people were not advanced.

I bought a possible answer to a homework problem which was  
completely inapplicable to the question due to my not having read  
about the subject matter.

Waiting for my girlfriend to come from her apt. to mine. She was  
very late and I thought something awful had happened.

I bought a new bed for my apt. and it squeaks when you move on  
it. I tried to fix it but could not.

Finding out that my grandfather had died. He lived in England and  
I had not seen him for 10 years.

Cleaning the bathroom of my apt. and realizing my roommate who  
had lived there all summer by himself had never cleaned the  
place.
Doing poorly on an exam that I thought I should do well.

Criticizing my mother when she refused to drive with the radio on.  
I told her that I thought she wasn't intelligent enough to cope  
with the radio.

My boyfriend and I were getting dressed up and putting make-up  
on to go to a Halloween Party. We were dressing up to be two  
mimes. It was very enjoyable and I thought we looked really good,  
it was an accomplishment. We were alone in his house.

I had been searching for housing for Fall at UCB and I was  
finally offered a place - then an ordeal followed, first I  
accepted then refused - related to my parents judgment (they're  
paying for me). Turns out that I was so upset at what my Dad said  
to me that I hung up on him. He called back and threatened to cut  
me off financially and emotionally.

We got news that my (almost) 21 years old brother died while  
visiting Europe of a cerebral hemorhage. It finally hit me an  
hour after we saw his corpse in the coffin. It felt like a door  
between himself and everything had closed and locked forever.

I was reading in the paper the feature on Henry Lucas who claims  
to have killed 380 people. He was a recreational killer and a  
necrophiliac and zoophiliac. He has raped and beaten many women  
and killed men too.

I was talking to my mom on the phone and she told me that she had  
just gotten an award that day in front of all these people and  
she asked me if I wanted her to send me the article in the temple  
newsletter to me. I said no very quickly and felt guilty for not  
being more interested and hurting her feelings.
When I found our my mother didn't have cancer.
I was alone and someone tried to break in from our back door.

When I did bad on a chamistry midterm which I could have done  
well.

When an employer of my younger sister (17 yrs) made a "pass" at  
her.

Occured while preparing for a midterm in Social Welfare that I  
thought was going to be very hard and felt unprepared for.
Day time robbery of our house.
Robbery mentioned under sadness.
When I found out I got accepted to Berkeley.

When a friend carelessly broke and object in my parent's house  
and did not apologize, or pay, or anything.

This person I know lied about how much income his parents made  
and received money through grants which he did not need. Another  
person is barely making it, did not lie, and did not receive  
enough money.
After a big fight with my parents.

While skiing in Squaw Valley, I was riding up a chair lift and  
right when the chair was above a sheer cliff of rocks, the chair  
lift stopped and all the chairs sagged and everything seemed to  
creak loudly.

My girlfriend wanted to breakup for an indefinite amt. of time.  
She said that she couldn't commit herself fully to the  
relationship without going out with other people. I was her first  
boyfriend.

I dreamed that this girl and I were cuddling in bed when my  
girlfriend walked in. I really love my girlfriend so I felt  
guilty and sad. I know that this is a wierd example but the dream  
and the feeling was clear to me as if it had really happened.

Losing a pet chick. Our family had just put the chick outside a  
few days before and then one morning it was gone.
NO RESPONSE
Having told a certain lie.

I experienced joy at a friend's 22nd birthday party. We had good  
food, good liquid, good company, good music, and an overall warm  
atmosphere. The birthday girl and I communicate incredibly well.  
I felt very content, warm and inspired just talking with her  
giving her a neck massage.

Two summers ago my best friend and I drove into unknown mountains  
at midnight to pick up my broken car. We told one another  
horrifically scary ghost/murder stories and succeeded in scaring  
eachother pretty well - even though somewhere in our heads we  
knew the fears were unjustified.

I had just seen my pseudo-girlfriend and our conversation angered  
me greatly.
My grandfather died thirteen years ago.

When one individual takes advantage of and/or injures another  
relatively defenseless individual, consciously. I feel disgust  
mingled with anger. A person on my dorm floor verbally assaulted  
another person for having a certain religious belief.

I borrowed $ 20.00 from a friend and paid him back much later  
than I had originally intended.

While studying chemistry with a friend we became angry with  
eachother because we were both fed up.

I received a letter from my grandmother. She has obviusly  
suffered a lot from my grandfather's suffering health. She  
mentioned things she had gotten him and he would never use.

I was driving on to a busy freeway during rush hour and it was  
slightly raining. A diesel truck was coming very close behind me  
and I was close behind a pick-up. I changed lanes and barely hit  
the truck and ran a Honda of the road. I was scared to death to  
go back and see if I caused him to crash.

I was really pissed when the Russians boycotted the '84 Olympics.  
I had anger towards them and Jimmy Crter. I was very anxious to  
see it.

It made me very sad to hear that some construction company was  
going to build houses on the beautiful hills by my house.

I vividly remember having feelings of disgust toward some of my  
jr. high classmates who didn't work at all on their schoolwork  
and who would coplain and take my tax money when I was older and  
more successful than they were. At the time I pictured some  
adults like this that I knew in the complaining situation.

I could have died when I was caught cheating on a test in high  
school. That was my first and last time.

When I didn't study for tests in High School. In particular   
remember a physics test. I didn't study because my friends talked  
me out of it and we did something else boring. I felt so helpless  
just being there - then guilt set in because I was very close to  
getting an A in the class.

When  first came to CAL I went to a rally on Sproul and I later  
learned that the rally was conducted by the Moonie cult. They  
were taking pictures at the rally, so I was afraid that they  
would circulate the pictures and then kidnap people. I did not  
know how the cult worked. I was scared.

When I was faced with writing an essay and I didn't want to do it  
I was angry that I had to write an essay and angry at myself for  
not having the time to write a good essay.

I went to go get a bike innertube fixed. I fixed it and I was  
supposed to pay previously but I didn't. I said I would after I  
fixed the tire. After fixing the tire, the salesperson who helped  
me was gone so I walked out of the store without paying. I felt  
guilty so I went inside and paid for the tire.

I had met someone and we became good friends. Our relationship  
grew closer and now he is my boyfriend. I felt joy when I found  
out how he felt about me.

I feared that my dog's eye was infected too much. He had played  
around in the weeds and a foxtail had gotten under his eyelid. I  
took him to the vet and I feared that he may go blind because of  
the foxtail.

One of my friends kept criticizing me about everything I did. I  
thought she was kidding, but later I found out that she was  
serious.

I felt disgusted when I found out that someone had betrayed me.  
That person had been dishonest with me and I felt used.

After taking a difficult midterm for one of my classes, I felt  
shame for not studying as much as I should have. I was ashamed of  
the results of the midterm.

A close friend of mine was leaving for graduate school out of  
state. I had arranged to gather some people together the day  
before he left to be with him and have a good time, but I didn't  
pay as much attention to him as I should have.

I was on this amusement park ride at Marriots Great America. It  
went way up in the air and then around and around. Heights are  
not my favorite spots in life.

Recently, my sister-in-law's horse was poisoned by a plant and  
died. The horse was very obedient and exceptional with children.

I was disgusted at the behavior of these boys I work with in the  
scouting program. They showed a lack of interest, unrest, and at  
times just plain rude behavior.

I had a test in the class and I had not adequately prepared  
myself. I didn't fare so well on the exam and I felt bad about  
it.

I was supposed to have done some things for my mother, but just  
plain didn't get around to it.

My old boyfriend - yes the same one - asked me out. We had a good  
time. Then he asked me out the following week. He actually took  
interest.

I was physically assaulted and sexually abused about a year ago.  
Just the feeling that I might not get away intact, or even alive,  
produced fear.

My nephew's mother just left one day (my brother and she were  
not married). My nephew, Anthony, was shaken. I was sad for him  
because a similar situation happened to me.

I tried after months to begin talking to my boyfriend again. He  
ignored me. I felt I had lowered my pride and became his  
"doormat".

I had found out that I was pregnant. I talked it over with my  
boyfriend and he was unsupportive - yet encouraged an abortion -  
I did.

My apartment has had three robberies in the last month. The guy  
upstairs just got robbed making it the fourth.

When my roommate's boyfriend assaulted me. He was threatening me,  
calling me names and pushing me around.

I was going to go on a vacation to Texas this summer but was  
unable to go because of registration.

I didn't do very well on a midterm and I'm disgusted with myself  
because I was prepared and thought I did well.
When I dated my friend's boyfriend after they had broken up.

A friend was going to come stay the weekend with me, but  
something came up and I cancelled out on him.

After being depressed because of a very bad relationship, my  
first love called me and told me that he would always care for me  
no matter what I did.

My mother kicked my surrogate father out and he in turn did not  
care for the dog, Afthur, he bought for the family. His lack of  
concern lead tho Arthur's death on the freeway. I loved Arthur  
like a brother. He was easy to talk to.

I thought that the guy I had been associating with for over a  
year went out 2 or 3 times with a high school girl whom he claimed  
not to like.

The fact that I was pregnant. I was always considered level  
headed and did not have sex until 18 and out of high school.

I was pregnant and thought that by not having the baby I would  
hurt the father like he did me regardless of the life we had  
created.

When I walked to church with my roommate, a bum told us to call  
the police and he started following us.
When my roommate's moped was stolen I was very angry.
The same for guilt would apply.

I added a little   ?   to a yield in an experiment to get more of  
a yield.

Third highest grade in the class and the best answer given for  
one question (the question was graded by the professor and he  
indicated he liked my answer).

We are repainting rooms in my house. My mother started to enact  
plans to paint my room without consulting me.

Recent break-up with my girlfriend. We had been together for over  
a year. I was overseas and discovered over the phone (while I was  
at work).

I attended a ceremony in Denmark which is comparable to our  
Halloween. They build a large bonfire and place a life size dummy  
of a witch. The crowd cheered when the dummy burst into flames.

After watching the 49ers lose game after game, year after year, I  
was finally rewarded with a Super Bowl victory which made me  
extremely happy.

While swimming, I hit my head at the bottom of the pool and  
required stitches. I later learned that the consequences could  
have been much more severe and that terrified me.

I was rushing home from school because there was a 49er game that  
night. I got into a non-injury accident, which was all my fault,  
but destroyed the front of my car. The truck I hit was undamaged.

When I learned that my dad had cancer. I knew he was going to the  
hospital for some tests. My mom told me when she picked me up one  
weekend from CAL to take me home.

Now that the 49ers are winners, the fans are coming out of the  
woodwork and jumping on the bandwagon and that disgusts me.

When I was small, I would always fight with my younger sister and  
one time I hit her and knocked the wind out of her. I felt real  
bad about it.
I felt joy when my boyfriend proposed to me in marriage.
I felt fear when I was young and left in my big house all alone.
I felt sad when my boyfriend and I were apart for some time.

I felt disgusted when I was in a restaurant which didn't appear  
to be clean and orderly. (I do not like to be in unclean  
environments).

I felt ashamed when I was confronted by a teaching assistant that  
a close friend and I were accused of cheating on a math exam.

When I did not defend my close friend when my father degraded  
him. I felt guilty for allowing my father to get away with his  
actions and for the hurt my friend felt. I cleared the matter up  
with my father a few weeks later.

After much trouble getting together in the first place my  
boyfriend and I celebrated our first anniversary.

I took a psych. experiment with a totally unappealing gay man as  
the experimentor, some homosexuals are funny or cute, but this  
guy was disgusting. Plus the experiment was about gays too.

I've had three midterms in the past two weeks and I hardly  
studied for any of them (like 1 or 2 days) I feel guilty that I  
hadn't studied and I got C's on all of them.

Winning a close volleyball game. (I'm on the intercollegiate team  
at CAL)
Speaking in front of a large group of people.
When a close friend drowned in the American River.
Getting a low grade on my physics midterm.

When my father's car got stolen from me. (A 1966 Ford Mustang -  
very hard to replace).

Getting sent on a company expense trip to another state to work  
for a week at that plan.
On my second plane trip, we ran into unexpected turbulence.

Having my personal objects rearranged by someone else without my  
consent and having it arranged to their taste. Then trying to  
find a particular object they rearranged for an hour or more.

Getting back my math midterm, I received a lower grade than I  
thought I would get. After going through the questions I felt  
that the grader had graded harshly and I had made only a few ?  
errors.
Getting a low grade on a midterm.
Promising to do a task for a friend and just forgetting about it.

When I finished my C.S. Project I was overjoyed. I felt relieved  
because it was due the next day and I was tired of looking at it.

I overturned in a canoe a few years back and I didn't know how to  
swim. Although I had a life-jacket on I still panicked.

I came out of the house at 7:20 am Monday morning getting ready t  
go to school and fight for a parking when I saw my car had a flat  
tire.

After my little sister's Graduation from High School my  
grandmother became very sick. She passed away a few months later.
I felt this when I was copying homework for one of my classes.

After yelling at my girlfriend, I felt bad because she was ?  
crying and upset.

A party with no worries (i.e. no tests homework etc.) many  
friends were present and good music.

I'm afraid of not being able to go to the school I want because  
of suffering grades.

I was stood up for a date function by someone who I really cared  
for.

I was supposed to do something and didn't. The person was really  
dependiong on me.

When my dad told me about something he had done against my  
mother.
When I heard my sister got in a bad car accident.
An Engineer I know wants war so he can get a job making bombs.
I did bad on a test I didn't study for.

Decided at the last minute not to do something that I said I  
would do with a person.
When I failed the S.S.C examination I felt very ashamed.

My first feeling of falling in love.  Coming across a person who  
made me feel love, happiness, joy, giving me a new and beautiful  
future, who made me dream.

When I came to know that my feelings for someone were not  
reciprocated.

I had a habit of wetting my bed when I was young.  One day, when  
I was invited to my friend's place to stay for the night, it  
happened again.  I was ashamed of myself.
I felt guilty when I lied to my parents.

A few weeks back my daughter had very high fever and I was scared  
that it might lead to brain damage or convulsions.

I felt angry when my mother-in-law did not handle my daughter  
properly and she fell down from the bed and hurt her head.

When my parents-in-law scolded me, without any reason, in front of the  
other members of my family for the first time.  They had called  
me from my room where I had been studying for my exams.

When the teacher asked me a question in class, concerning  
something I had read earlier, and I did not know the answer, so I  
felt ashamed in front of the whole class.

When my friend failed an exam by just one mark.  During this exam  
she had asked me to show her my answer sheet and I had not done  
it.  When the results came out, I thought that had I shown her my  
answer sheet she would have passed the exam.  I felt guilty as I  
had failed her.
When I decided to separate from my husband.

When my father talks about our relatives and favours them, I feel  
angry.
[ When my elders do not understand me in the right way.]

I went for a walk on the beach with a friend whom I had not seen  
for many months.  The weather was very pleasant, we had some  
ice-cream and lots of fun on the beach.

That day I was alone at home after coming home from school.  I did  
not know where everyone else had gone, I kept waiting for them to  
come back and nobody came.  It was getting very late and I was  
terrified.

A close friend of mine was to get married in a weeks time when  
her father died of a heart-attack.  I knew him well and felt bad  
on hearing of his death.

A girl, who is a friend of mine was having an affair with a boy  
who is also a friend of mine.  I got to know that this girl was  
also seeing another guy.  Later on, she just broke off with this friend  
of mine without giving any explanations.  This made him sad and  
depressed, and I felt disgust for this girl.

I had always been first in my class and in the preliminary board  
exams I scored the highest marks.  Then the exams were  
postponed and I neglected my studies as I was confident.  However  
when the final results came out I felt ashamed as I had scored  
less than 60% marks and my rank in the class was fifth or sixth.

I had gone to the hospital for my research and got late in  
reaching home.  I feared that when I reached home there would be  
a quarrel because of my being late.
[ I feel angry when somebody is unjust to me.]
[ I feel sad when somebody is unjust to me.]
When people around me did not understand me the right way.
I was angry this morning when I missed the train to university.

I felt ashamed when I had not attended a class and the teacher asked  
me the reason for my absence.

I acted in an English play in college and got the Best Actress  
award, while our play got the first place.

I have done the teachers training course (B.Ed).  During our  
training I was asked to handle the ninth standard class in a boys  
school.  I was scared to face the class the first day.

I was to meet a friend at the bus-stop (he was coming to visit  
us) and he did not turn up.  After having waited for him for some time      
(about an hour) I called him up, to be told that he did not  
intend to come as he was feeling tired.
When my sister died in a fire accident at home.
When my husband told me about his pre-marital affairs.
When I failed the ninth standard exam in school.

I had gone to see one of our professors about a book, and I did not  
 attend the class she took a few minutes later.

When I passsed the M.S.C board exams with first class, which I  
had not expected.

[ I have always been very scared and tense before an exam and  
before the declaration of the results.]

When my friend promised that she would come to my place, and did  
not turn up - I was annoyed at her.
I felt guilty when I lied to my parents.
I was very happy when I passed the B.A with first class marks.

I was having an argument with my brother on his behavior, then we   
started fighting and I got annoyed at him because he started  
teasing me.

My best friend got married and left her home-town to go and live  
in Poona.  After her wedding I felt sad.

I feel disgust at my neighbour, because she comes to our house with  
her child, who spoils our furniture.

When I failed the twelveth standard exams I was ashamed at  
having to see my parents later.
When my mother scolded me and I argued with her.
When I passed the B.A exams with first class results.
When I was coming back home alone at night.
When I failed the M.S.C exams.
When my father was ill.

When my friend who is close to me got engaged and did not invite  
me.
When I failed the M.S.C exam.
When I fought with my friends.

When I was 20 years old, I fell severely ill and was bed-ridden for  
6 months.  I felt very scared for my health and my studies.

My friend got married and went abroad, this made me feel sad and  
lonely.
When a begggar approached me for money, I felt disgusted.
When I got 1/2 out of 15 in Abnormal Psychology I felt ashamed.
Once I lied to my parents and this made me feel very guilty.

When I got a first class in the twelveth standard exams, I was very  
surprised and happy and I had a very good time with my friends.

When I was at S.Y.Bajaj I wanted to get admission in another  
college and this was not easy and I felt angry.

When my mother scolded me for something, very insignificant, without  
knowing the real cause of what had happened.

I feel disgusted at my cousin, who is bad-mannered, does not know  
how to behave and talk to others, he does not respect elders and  
lies all the time.

When I was taking the 11th standard exam, my friend who was sitting  
behind me asked me for some answers.  The teacher looked at us  
just then and scolded both of us.  Everyone started looking at us  
and I felt very guilty.

After completing high-school, I wanted to go abroad for a  
holiday.  I had never been abroad before and neither had I taken  
a holiday for a long time.  When finally my parents agreed and we  
got the airplane tickets I was over joyed.

It so happened that while staying at anaunt's place I discovered  
that I was afraid of sleeping in pitch darkness.  The room  
which my sister and I were sharing had no light, and I would  
refuse to sleep without having the light of the adjoining  
bathroom switched on.

When I see people with burns I feel sad, actually I can not even  
express my feelings as I think that they must suffer a lot.

When some of my close friends and colleagues talk about me and  
my work and say that I am the brightest student of the college.

Day before yesterday my mother bought me a new pair of shoes,  
without my having asked for them.  She told me that when she saw  
the pair of shoes she felt like buying them for me.  I really  
liked the shoes and they made me feel that my mother cares for  
me.

When for the first time I rode on a motorcycle with my brother.   
He was going so fast that I felt that I would fall off without my  
brother realizing it.

One of my friends asked me to go shopping with her, another  
friend of hers was also coming along.  During the outing they  
kept talking to each other and I felt left out, even when I tried  
to talk to them they seemed not to listen to me and did not pay  
me much attention.

Two years ago my best friend died in an accident, just a day  
before my birthray.  We were very close to each other and I felt  
very sad at loosing a close friend.

We had gone to our native village and I went to visit a tribal  
group which believes in Goddess Kali.  As it was a festival day they  
had to offer a hen to the Goddess so they cut the head off a hen  
right in front of my eyes.  I felt disgusted and evenb gave up  
eating meat after this incident.

As part of the assessment I had to speak on a subject in front  
of the class. I was not really prepared and I was just reading  
the stuff I had on a piece of paper, when some of the students   
asked me something I could not give them an answer.  I felt  
ashamed as I had not prepared the topic.

One day I went to see a movie without my parents permission.  It  
was an adult movie and I was scared that my parents would not  
allow me to see the movie.  However after coming home I felt very  
guilty at what I had done.

When my daughter gave her solo dance performance in Poona and  
there was a big applause, I was overjoyed.

I was in a garden one evening and I saw a snake coming towards  
me.

When my husband lied to me, tricked me and when I had to leave my  
home.

The way my husband and his family treated me - unfairly, cruelly,  
and unjustly.

I was ashamed at myself for having shouted at my daughter because  
of my marital break-up and the unfair way I was treated.
When I got married.

A girl whom I trusted and with whom I had shared personal, confidential  
matters twisted the facts and told it to a common friend of ours.  
 When this common friend told me the version my friend had told  
her, I was angry.
When my elder sister died.

My husband falls ill and does not follow the doctor's advice on  
the treatment or the diet control.

When I could neither measure up to the expectations of the teacher  
nor to my own expectations in one of the assignments.

The day I got married was the happiest day of my life.  Both of  
us felt that we were right for each other in every way and we had  
no doubts about our compatibility right from the day we got  
engaged.

One morning I was standing at the bus-stop and the bus passed by  
without stopping, even though there were only 8-10 passengers  
inside.  I felt angry at the rude behaviour of the bus driver and   
conductor.

At the death of my friend's father and especially as this  
happened ten days before her wedding.

I was disgusted at the existing red-tape in the government  
offices.  I accquired my passport three months after having applied for  
it and I had to go back five times to them to correct a minor  
error.

When I could not pass my exams with good marks.  My wedding was  
to take place 15 days after the exams and I tried to convince  
myself that this was the reason for my not having done well.    
However, I thought that had I really put my mind to doing well at  
the exams I would have done well.

When I succeeded in achieving a scholarship for which I had  
strived hard during a period of financial, personal and physical  
stress.

When I had to travel alone, unescorted for the first time.     It  
was an over-night journey by train to a distant place.

I put in two years of hard work and it was neither looked at nor  
appreciated.

Despite my being affectionate, sincere, and helpful to close   
relatives of mine; they turned around and accused me of being  
inconsiderate in my relationship with them.
The first time that I had to go up on the stage to give a speech.

[ I feel a sense of joy whenever I complete a piece of writing  
which is part of my work.  Intense reading also brings me joy.  I  
also feel happy when I reminiscent about them.]

I was coming home from a relative's place and it was about  
9.30/10 P.M.  I felt slightly apprehensive when I got off the bus  
and started walking towards my place.  I was confident that  
nothing would happen to me, yet there was this slight feeling of  
fear.

Uncleaniness at my work place.  The place is generally not very  
clean, but when it reaches a point, I get angry at the person  
who is supposed to clean the place and the people who are  
supposed to supervise him.

I got into a tight pair of trousers and examined myself in the  
mirror.  My back looked unpresentable and I felt ashamed at my  
wanting to wear those clothes that day.  I quickly changed into  
another dress.

When I do not put in the needed amount of hours of work or study  
for the day, I feel guilty and try to make up for the lost  
time.

When I got the scholarship I was very happy as the finacial  
burden of the family was reduced.

I experienced fear when I was not prepared for the final year  
degree exams.

When the others did not do their bit of work on a group  
assignment task, and I had to do all the work.

I felt ashamed when I fought with my mother on some issue, and  
caused her trouble.

I had enough time to do my assignment, and I did not do it well.   
When the lecturer scolded me, I had this feeling.
When I was selected at TISS X.
When I almost walked on a snake.
When my mother left for Kenya.
[ When I see that the toilet is unclean.]
When I could not complete my assignment on time.

At the pre-university, I was appreciated as an examplary  
student by our pricipal.  This is something which made me feel  
very happy.

When my sister lost her only son, who was sixteen years old.  I  
felt very bad about it as this was the first death in my family  
and then I learned slowly to understand to life.

When I was in a Christian institution, sometimes the nuns would  
send back the people who came to visit us when it was not the  
visiting hours.  This disgusted me.

The day I got a letter from the U.G.C informing me that I had  
been awarded the junior research fellowship.

When I was working in Delhi, I had gone alone to see the hostel  
where I would be residing.

When a relative, who had come to our place, created untidyness  
and dirtyness.
When I had to leave home to go to some other place to study.
When I broke-down while seeing off my friend.

[ When I have achieved what I wanted to achieve, I feel the above  
stated emotion. Also when I am sucessful.]

Once when I was walking alone at mid-night, I happened to put my  
foot on a frog, as it felt smooth I thought that it was a snake   
and I felt afraid.

My friend and I were to attend a very important meeting and he  
had promised to come and pick me up.  But he did not turn up and  
I felt very angry at him.

I was really hoping that I would pass the examination, but I  
failed and so I felt very sad.

[ I feel disgusted at people who talk negatively about a person  
without knowing the person well.]
[ Whenever I do something prohibited or wrong I feel guilty.]

When I stood first in the B.A exams.  Earlier I had heard of  
these boys and girls who were toppers, but when I first heard of  
me having topped I could not believe it.

When my son fell off the cot at the age of 5 months, I became  
very nervous and thought that it would cause defects in his head.

When I heard the news of the death of my father.  It was in the  
evening and I was alone all night in my room trying to remember  
the face of my father.

One day I addressed my husband in an abusive manner in front of  
his friends.  Later on I realized this myself and felt ashamed of  
myself.

My mother misunderstood me and prevented me from doing something.  
 In return I did not talk to her for a few days, only later on I  
realized that what she had done had been for my good.

I felt afraid just before receiving the question paper of the  
part II exam.

I remember that when I was in school I saw a case of partiality -  
one of the teachers gave private coaching classes to some girls  
and she would give these girls extra attention in class and would  
ignore the others.

I was most disgusted when I had to make a nagging three day  
journey recently from Calcutta to Bombay.  It was very boring and  
tiring.

I remember that once, a friend did not co-operate with me due to  
some unavoidable reasons.  Unaware of this I treated her unjustly  
till I realized everything, and then I felt ashamad of my deeds.

I did badly in one of the vital exams, despite getting proper
